translated: enjoyment as a master, enjoyment as a share, enjoyment as a gift, enjoyment as a debt, and enjoyment as theft.

translated: The trees that are chopped down, cut up, and split

analyzed: sgra brtan zhing sgra zab la rnga'i sgra lta bu de dag khyim bdag zhing pa des 'dor bar byed do //
translated: make a loud noise, a deep sound like the sound of a drum. The farmer throws them away.

original: de na shing gang dag brdungs rab tu brdungs kun du brdungs pa na sgra mi brtan zhing sgra mi zab rda'i sgra lta bu mi 'don pa de dag khyim bdag zhing pa des rtsa ba nas bcad de mgo bo dag blangs te /
analyzed: de na shing gang dag brdungs rab tu brdungs kun du brdungs pa na sgra mi brtan zhing sgra mi zab rda'i sgra lta bu mi 'don pa de dag khyim bdag zhing pa des rtsa ba nas bcad de mgo bo dag blangs te /
translated: The householder farmer cuts from the root those trees that, when shaken, rattled, and shaken again, do not produce a stable sound, a deep sound, a sound like a drum.

original: gang yang rul cing snying po med par gyur pa dag dor nas chu'i yur ba dag 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: gang yang rul cing snying po med par gyur pa dag dor nas chu'i yur ba dag 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: He takes their tops and discards the rotten, pithless parts, and uses the rest to make irrigation ditches.

original: de bzhin du len pa dag las 'dra ste zhes bya ba nas /🔽snga ma bzhin du dge sbyong sun 'byin par byed pa byung zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du len pa dag las 'dra ste zhes bya ba nas / snga ma bzhin du dge sbyong sun 'byin par byed pa byung zhing /
translated: In the same way, there are those who are like this in regard to taking up...🔽...as before, up to “a monk who causes division in the saṅgha.”

original: dge sbyong gi sre da dang dge sbyong shing rul ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas 'dis dge sbyong gzhan dag kyang sun 'byin par gyur zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang snam sbyar gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi sre da dang dge sbyong shing rul ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas 'dis dge sbyong gzhan dag kyang sun 'byin par gyur zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang snam sbyar gyi bar du'o //
translated: He is like a monk who is a thorn, a monk who is rotten wood, up to “he causes other monks to be divided.” He goes and comes, and he wears his outer robe like this.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: khyim bdag zhing pa dag 'bras kyi phung po 'phyar bar byed pa na /
analyzed: khyim bdag zhing pa dag 'bras kyi phung po 'phyar bar byed pa na /
translated: When the householder farmers are winnowing a pile of rice,

original: 'bras gang dag brtan par gnas shing snying po dang bcas pa de dag @225a * //
analyzed: 'bras gang dag brtan par gnas shing snying po dang bcas pa de dag @225a * //
translated: Those grains that are firm and have a kernel

original: phyogs gcig tu gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu gnas par 'gyur /
translated: will remain in one place.

original: gang phub ma dang snying po med pa de dag rlung gis phyogs gcig tu byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang phub ma dang snying po med pa de dag rlung gis phyogs gcig tu byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Those that are chaff and have no kernel will be blown in one place by the wind.

original: 'dis gzhan dag kyang rlag par byed par 'gyur ro zhes khyim bdag zhing pa des btsas shing bsrungs nas 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis gzhan dag kyang rlag par byed par 'gyur ro zhes khyim bdag zhing pa des btsas shing bsrungs nas 'jig par byed do //
translated: This will destroy the others as well.

original: de bzhin du lhung bzed len pa dag la 'dra bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /🔽dge slong sun 'byin par byed pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhung bzed len pa dag la 'dra bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas / dge slong sun 'byin par byed pa 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, those who take up the alms bowl will be like this.🔽A monk who causes others to lose faith will appear.

original: dge sbyong gi sre da dang / dge sbyong shing rul ba lta bu dang / dge slong snying po med pa zhes bya ba nas gzhan dag kyang sun 'byin par 'gyur du 'ongs ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi sre da dang / dge sbyong shing rul ba lta bu dang / dge slong snying po med pa zhes bya ba nas gzhan dag kyang sun 'byin par 'gyur du 'ongs ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: A monk who is a thorn for the ascetics, a monk who is like a rotten tree, a monk who is without essence, will appear.

original: ston pas gzhan yang 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ston pas gzhan yang 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Teacher said this and more:

original: kha na ma tho bcas shing 'khyog / sgyu dang ser sna dang bcas shing //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bcas shing 'khyog / sgyu dang ser sna dang bcas shing //
translated: and with deceit and avarice,

original: dben par song ste nye bar spyod //
analyzed: dben par song ste nye bar spyod //
translated: they go off to a secluded place and enjoy themselves.

original: sdig par lta zhing ma gus pa //
analyzed: sdig par lta zhing ma gus pa //
translated: They have evil views and are disrespectful,

original: brdzun du smra zhing mi shes pa //
analyzed: brdzun du smra zhing mi shes pa //
translated: lie, and are ignorant.🔽Knowing that they live together

original: sdig pa 'dod cing khro ba dang // lhan cig gnas pa shes byas nas //
analyzed: sdig pa 'dod cing khro ba dang // lhan cig gnas pa shes byas nas //
translated: with those who desire evil and are angry,

original: de dag 'dre zhing 'grogs pa dag //
analyzed: de dag 'dre zhing 'grogs pa dag //
translated: they associate with them and befriend them.

original: rtag tu rab tu spang bar bya //
analyzed: rtag tu rab tu spang bar bya //
translated: They should always be completely avoided.

original: dge slong min pa dge slong du //🔽smra ba sred bsal bar gyis //
analyzed: dge slong min pa dge slong du // smra ba sred bsal bar gyis //
translated: Those who say that non-monks are monks🔽should be expelled.

original: shing rul dag ni bsal bar gyis //
analyzed: shing rul dag ni bsal bar gyis //
translated: You should remove rotten wood,

original: snying po med pa dor bar gyis //
analyzed: snying po med pa dor bar gyis //
translated: discard what is worthless.

original: sdig 'dod rnam par spangs nas ni //
analyzed: sdig 'dod rnam par spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned those who desire evil,🔽with perfect conduct,🔽pure and very pure,

original: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang // dag cing rab tu dag pa dang // lhan cig gnas par sems pas na //
analyzed: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang // dag cing rab tu dag pa dang // lhan cig gnas par sems pas na //
translated: thinking of living together,

original: de dag 'dus shing tshogs pa rnams //
analyzed: de dag 'dus shing tshogs pa rnams //
translated: those who gather together

original: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur //
translated: will make suffering come to an end.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di ltar dge slong ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, there are four types of monks.

original: drug na drug pa'i mdo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang po las 'di ltar 'don te /
analyzed: drug na drug pa'i mdo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang po las 'di ltar 'don te /
translated: In the first verse of the summary of the Sutra on the Six, it is recited thus:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phreng ba can nas ljongs rgyu zhing sdig pa can du gshegs nas dza lo ka'i tshal na bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phreng ba can nas ljongs rgyu zhing sdig pa can du gshegs nas dza lo ka'i tshal na bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, wandering in stages through the country of Malla, arrived at Pāvā and stayed in the Cunda Grove.

original: sdig pa can gyi gyad rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das phreng ba can nas ljongs rgyu zhing sdig pa can du gshegs te dza lo ka'i tshal na bzhugs so zhes thos te /
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi gyad rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das phreng ba can nas ljongs rgyu zhing sdig pa can du gshegs te dza lo ka'i tshal na bzhugs so zhes thos te /
translated: The Malla warriors of Pāvā heard that the Blessed One, wandering in stages through the country of Malla, had arrived at Pāvā and was staying in the Cunda Grove.

original: thos nas 'dus shing tshogs te ;🔽rab tu 'dus shing tshogs nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: thos nas 'dus shing tshogs te ; rab tu 'dus shing tshogs nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: Having heard this, they assembled, gathered,🔽and approached the Blessed One.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te /🔽phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te / phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One🔽and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
translated: Having sat to one side,

original: sdig pa can gyi gyad rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos dang ldan pa'i @225b gtam gyis yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / yang dag par dga' ba dang / yang dag par gsal ba mdzad do //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi gyad rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos dang ldan pa'i @225b gtam gyis yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / yang dag par dga' ba dang / yang dag par gsal ba mdzad do //
translated: enthused, and delighted the sinful wrestlers.

original: de'i tshe na 'khor dus pa de'i nang nas mgar ba'i bu tsan da zhes bya ba 'dus par gyur cing 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe na 'khor dus pa de'i nang nas mgar ba'i bu tsan da zhes bya ba 'dus par gyur cing 'dug par gyur to //
translated: At that time, in the assembly, there was a blacksmith's son named Canda.🔽Then the Blessed One, with a Dharma discourse, instructed, inspired,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sdig pa can gyi gyad rnams chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan cing yang dag par bskul yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung bar bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sdig pa can gyi gyad rnams chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan cing yang dag par bskul yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung bar bzhugs so //
translated: enthused, and delighted the sinful wrestlers, and remained silent.

original: sdig pa can gyi gyad rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi gyad rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: The sinful wrestlers rejoiced in and praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /
translated: They bowed their heads at the Blessed One's feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo //
translated: and departed from the Blessed One's presence.

original: mgar ba'i bu tsun da de nyid du 'dug go //
analyzed: mgar ba'i bu tsun da de nyid du 'dug go //
translated: The smith's son Cunda remained there.

original: de nas mgar ba'i bu tsun da sdig pa can gyi gyad dag song nas yun ring du lon pa dang / stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzer te /
analyzed: de nas mgar ba'i bu tsun da sdig pa can gyi gyad dag song nas yun ring du lon pa dang / stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzer te /
translated: Then, when a long time had passed since the sinful wrestlers had left, Cunda rose from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar zhing phyag byas nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar zhing phyag byas nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and with palms joined in respect, he bowed to the Blessed One and said to him:

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa bdag gi khyim du gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa bdag gi khyim du gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
translated: Blessed One, please allow the Blessed One and the community of monks to take their meal at my house.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mgar ba'i bcu tsun da la cang mi gsung bas gnang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mgar ba'i bcu tsun da la cang mi gsung bas gnang bar mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the smith's son Cunda by remaining silent.

original: de nas mgar ba'i bu tsun da bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas song ngo //
analyzed: de nas mgar ba'i bu tsun da bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas song ngo //
translated: Then, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent, the smith's son Cunda bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet and left.

original: de nas mgar ba'i bu tsun da de nyid kyi mtshan mo shing thog dang 'bru dag btsos shing bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gi dge 'dun la gtsang zhing bsod pa'i kha zas dang ston mo dag bshams te /
analyzed: de nas mgar ba'i bu tsun da de nyid kyi mtshan mo shing thog dang 'bru dag btsos shing bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gi dge 'dun la gtsang zhing bsod pa'i kha zas dang ston mo dag bshams te /
translated: Then, on that very night, the smith’s son Cunda cooked and prepared fruits and grains, and set out pure, fine, and abundant food and drink for the Blessed One and the saṅgha of monks.

original: gdan dag bshams chu snod dag bzhag cing btsun pa gdugs tshod kyi dus la bab kyis da ni bcom ldan 'das dus mkhyen par mdzad du gsol zhes dus tshod rjod par byed pa'i pho nya dag btang ngo //
analyzed: gdan dag bshams chu snod dag bzhag cing btsun pa gdugs tshod kyi dus la bab kyis da ni bcom ldan 'das dus mkhyen par mdzad du gsol zhes dus tshod rjod par byed pa'i pho nya dag btang ngo //
translated: He prepared seats, set out water vessels, and sent messengers to announce the time, saying, “Venerable ones, the time for the meal has come. Now the Blessed One should know that the time has arrived.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te /
translated: Then, in the morning, the Blessed One put on his lower robe and upper robe, took his alms bowl,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor zhing dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi tshogs kyi mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor zhing dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi tshogs kyi mngon sum du byas te /
translated: and, surrounded by the assembly of monks and in the presence of the assembly of monks,

original: mgar ba'i su tsun da'i gdugs tshod gang na ba der gshegs so //
analyzed: mgar ba'i su tsun da'i gdugs tshod gang na ba der gshegs so //
translated: he went to the place where the smith Cunda’s meal was to be held.

original: nye bar gshegs nas dge slong gi dge 'dun @226a * //
analyzed: nye bar gshegs nas dge slong gi dge 'dun @226a * //
translated: Having arrived, the Blessed One

original: gyi gung la gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
analyzed: gyi gung la gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
translated: and sat down on the seat prepared for him.

original: de nas mgar ba'i bu tsun das sangs rgyas dang dge slong gi dge 'dun mngon par phyogs shing bde bar bzhugs par rig nas rgya shug gi 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang legs par sbyar ba'i 'bru dag gis rang gi lag nas 'bul zhing stobs par byed
analyzed: de nas mgar ba'i bu tsun das sangs rgyas dang dge slong gi dge 'dun mngon par phyogs shing bde bar bzhugs par rig nas rgya shug gi 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang legs par sbyar ba'i 'bru dag gis rang gi lag nas 'bul zhing stobs par byed
translated: Then Cunda, the smith’s son, knowing that the Buddha and the community of monks had sat down, with his own hands served and satisfied them with excellent food and delicacies, with a variety of flavors.

original: do // dge slong gi dge 'dun la yang gtsang zhing bsod pa'i kha zas dag rang gi lag gis 'bul zhing stobs par byed do //
analyzed: do // dge slong gi dge 'dun la yang gtsang zhing bsod pa'i kha zas dag rang gi lag gis 'bul zhing stobs par byed do //
translated: He also served and satisfied the community of monks with pure, fine, and delicious food with his own hands.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong sdig pa can dge slong gzhan zhig gi rmog brkus te mchan khung du bcug ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong sdig pa can dge slong gzhan zhig gi rmog brkus te mchan khung du bcug ste /
translated: At that time, a sinful monk stole another monk’s robe and put it under his arm.

original: dge slong sdig pa can de sangs rgyas kyi mthus sangs rgyas dang tsun das mthong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong sdig pa can de sangs rgyas kyi mthus sangs rgyas dang tsun das mthong ngo //
translated: By the Buddha’s power, the sinful monk was seen by the Buddha and Cunda.

original: de nas mgar ba'i bu tsun das rnam grangs du mar rgya shug gi 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang legs par sbyar ba'i 'bru dag gis rang gi lag nas 'bul zhing stobs par byed cing dge slong gi dge 'dun la yang gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba
analyzed: de nas mgar ba'i bu tsun das rnam grangs du mar rgya shug gi 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang legs par sbyar ba'i 'bru dag gis rang gi lag nas 'bul zhing stobs par byed cing dge slong gi dge 'dun la yang gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba
translated: Then the smith’s son Cunda offered the Blessed One a variety of excellent jujube fruits and well-prepared grains with his own hands, and to the saṅgha of monks he offered clean, delicious food

original: dang btung bas rang gi lag nas 'bul zhing bstabs par byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol zhing phyag bcabs te lhung bzed gyu bar rig nas /
analyzed: dang btung bas rang gi lag nas 'bul zhing bstabs par byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol zhing phyag bcabs te lhung bzed gyu bar rig nas /
translated: and drink with his own hands. When he saw that the Blessed One had finished eating, washed his hands, and put away his bowl,

original: stan dma' ba zhig blangs te bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'dug ste tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis dri ba zhus pa /
analyzed: stan dma' ba zhig blangs te bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'dug ste tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis dri ba zhus pa /
translated: he took a low seat, sat before the Blessed One, and asked his questions in verse:

original: pha rol rgal cing som nyi spangs //
analyzed: pha rol rgal cing som nyi spangs //
translated: “Having crossed over to the other side, you have abandoned doubt.

original: thub par ba zad rnams 'dren mchog //
analyzed: thub par ba zad rnams 'dren mchog //
translated: You are the supreme guide for those who have exhausted existence.

original: kha lo sgyur mchog 'jig rten na //
analyzed: kha lo sgyur mchog 'jig rten na //
translated: In the world, you are the supreme charioteer.

original: dge sbyong du mchis bdag 'dri'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong du mchis bdag 'dri'o //
translated: I ask you, ascetic, who are you?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: dge sbyong bzhi ste lnga pa med //
analyzed: dge sbyong bzhi ste lnga pa med //
translated: “There are four ascetics, no fifth exists.

original: de dag gsal bar ngas shes bya //
analyzed: de dag gsal bar ngas shes bya //
translated: I know them clearly.

original: lam gyis rgyal dang lam ston dang / lam phyir 'tsho dang lam sun 'byin //
analyzed: lam gyis rgyal dang lam ston dang / lam phyir 'tsho dang lam sun 'byin //
translated: “The one who is victorious through the path, the one who teaches the path, the one who lives for the sake of the path, and the one who criticizes the path.

original: gsol pa / lam gyis rgyal ba gang la brjod //
analyzed: gsol pa / lam gyis rgyal ba gang la brjod //
translated: ” The gods asked, “Who is victorious through the path?

original: ji ltar mtshungs med lam ston yin //
analyzed: ji ltar mtshungs med lam ston yin //
translated: How is he the teacher of the incomparable path?

original: lam phyir 'tsho ba dris pas gsungs //
analyzed: lam phyir 'tsho ba dris pas gsungs //
translated: Please explain the one who lives for the sake of the path.

original: lam sun 'byin pa gsal bar mdzod //
analyzed: lam sun 'byin pa gsal bar mdzod //
translated: Clearly explain the one who criticizes the path.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: gang zhig the tshom zug rngu spangs //
analyzed: gang zhig the tshom zug rngu spangs //
translated: “The one who has abandoned the pain of doubt,

original: gzhan gyis bkri min mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkri min mya ngan 'das //
translated: who is not led by others, and who has attained nirvāṇa.

original: 'jig rten lhar bcas ston pa yi //
analyzed: 'jig rten lhar bcas ston pa yi //
translated: The one who teaches the world and its gods

original: sangs rgyas lam gyis rgyal zhes brjod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lam gyis rgyal zhes brjod //
translated: is called the Buddha, the Victorious One on the path.

original: blang dang spang bya mchog rig nas //
analyzed: blang dang spang bya mchog rig nas //
translated: Knowing what to adopt and what to abandon,

original: chos rnams de bzhin ston cing 'byed //
analyzed: chos rnams de bzhin ston cing 'byed //
translated: he teaches and distinguishes phenomena as they are.

original: thub pa dkri min the tshom chad //
analyzed: thub pa dkri min the tshom chad //
translated: The Sage, who is not led by others and whose doubts are cut,

original: lam ston dge sbyong gnyis pa yin //
analyzed: lam ston dge sbyong gnyis pa yin //
translated: is the second ascetic who teaches the path.

original: gang zhig chos gnas @226b legs ston cing //
analyzed: gang zhig chos gnas @226b legs ston cing //
translated: The one who teaches well the abiding of phenomena,

original: dran pa'i bdag nyid lam phyir 'tsho //
analyzed: dran pa'i bdag nyid lam phyir 'tsho //
translated: who lives for the sake of the path with mindfulness as his nature,

original: kha na ma tho med gnas slob //
analyzed: kha na ma tho med gnas slob //
translated: and who trains in the state free from blame,

original: dge slong gsum pa lam phyir 'tsho //
analyzed: dge slong gsum pa lam phyir 'tsho //
translated: The third is the monk who lives by the road.

original: 'phags pa'i rtags kyis g-yogs byas nas //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rtags kyis g-yogs byas nas //
translated: He is covered with the signs of a noble one,🔽but is competitive, quarrelsome, and dishonest.

original: 'gran cing khyim sun 'byin pa dang // 'chal cing ma ngul  sgyu dang bcas //🔽gzugs brnyan bzhin sbyong lam sun 'byin //
analyzed: 'gran cing khyim sun 'byin pa dang // 'chal cing ma ngul  sgyu dang bcas // gzugs brnyan bzhin sbyong lam sun 'byin //
translated: He is a hypocrite, a monk in name only.

original: shes nas ma dad par mi bya //
analyzed: shes nas ma dad par mi bya //

analyzed: dag dang ma dag mnyam par byed //

analyzed: gcig gis sdig pa'i las byas nas ;

analyzed: phyi rol gser g-yogs sun 'byin ltar //

analyzed: dge zhing sdig pa rab sdangs nas //

analyzed: nyon mongs zad cing log par 'gyur //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mgar ba'i bu tsun nga la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bskul zhing dga' bar mdzad nas bzhengs te gshegs so zhes gsungs so //

translated: If there is a fault,🔽

analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba ma yin no // mdo sde dang 'dul ba las zhes bya ba la re zhig mdo sde ni sangs rgyas kyi rnam par bshad pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa'i dang po las te /
translated: it is not a defeat.🔽With regard to what is said in the sutras and the Vinaya, in the sutras, in the first of the four line verses that summarize the Buddha's explanations in the Ksudraka Collection,

analyzed: mdzod kyi gnas 'di nyid du //

analyzed: skyabs su song ba la med /

original: @227a * // ces bris par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: @227a * // ces bris par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be consulted in the Treasury of Abhidharma.🔽In the Vinaya it says, “One should be expelled in this way.”

original: 'dul ba las kyang de lta bu bsnyil bar bya'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la rab tu byung ba'i gzhi'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa bslab pa'i gnas bzhi pa las te /
analyzed: 'dul ba las kyang de lta bu bsnyil bar bya'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la rab tu byung ba'i gzhi'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa bslab pa'i gnas bzhi pa las te /
translated: In the second of the two line verses that summarize the basis of the vows of a fully ordained monk, in the fourth topic of training, it says:🔽“Driving away crows, refuting,

original: bya rog skrod dang sun 'byin dang // rkun ma'i gnas dang ma ning dang / zhes 'byung la /
analyzed: bya rog skrod dang sun 'byin dang // rkun ma'i gnas dang ma ning dang / zhes 'byung la /
translated: the abode of thieves, and a paṇḍaka.”

original: phran tshegs kyi sgo bdun pa sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa las kyang /
analyzed: phran tshegs kyi sgo bdun pa sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa las kyang /
translated: The fourth chapter of the Vinaya Verses on the seven topics of the Ksudraka Collection states:

original: mtshan gnyis de bzhin mtshan gcig dang / zhes 'byung la /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis de bzhin mtshan gcig dang / zhes 'byung la /
translated: Those with two organs and likewise those with one organ.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu 'byin pa'i dus na brtag pa'i phyir mkhan pos 'di ltar dri bar bya ste /🔽khyod za ma ma yin nam /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu 'byin pa'i dus na brtag pa'i phyir mkhan pos 'di ltar dri bar bya ste / khyod za ma ma yin nam /
translated: Therefore, when one is fully ordained, the preceptor should ask,🔽Are you a eunuch?

original: ma ning ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma ning ma yin nam /
translated: Are you a hermaphrodite?🔽Are you a paṇḍaka?

original: mtshan gnyis pa ma yin nam zhes dri zhing de khas len na khyod mi skye ba'i chos can yin gyis song shig ces brjod par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa ma yin nam zhes dri zhing de khas len na khyod mi skye ba'i chos can yin gyis song shig ces brjod par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If he admits to being a paṇḍaka, he should be told, You are not a candidate for ordination, you should leave.🔽Also, a sūtra states:

original: gang yang mdo las ji skad du dge slong dag sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu ni zla ba phyed phyed cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang mdo las ji skad du dge slong dag sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu ni zla ba phyed phyed cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: Monks, a nāga born from an egg is a nonhuman.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o ;
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o ;
translated: The nidana is that this occurred in Śrāvastī.

original: / dge slong dag sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu ni zla ba phyed phyed cing gnas nas byung ste shin tu yongs su dag pa'i yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la nye bar gnas par byed de /
analyzed: / dge slong dag sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu ni zla ba phyed phyed cing gnas nas byung ste shin tu yongs su dag pa'i yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la nye bar gnas par byed de /
translated: “Monks, the nāgas born from eggs emerge from their abodes every half-month and observe the poṣadha of the eightfold precepts, which is extremely pure and perfect.

original: lus sa la bskyur cing gnas te rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'jig rten gang la yang gnod par mi byed do //
analyzed: lus sa la bskyur cing gnas te rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'jig rten gang la yang gnod par mi byed do //
translated: They lie down on the ground and do not harm any living being, whether moving or unmoving.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dge slong dag sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu 'di snyam du bdag sngon mir gyur pa na shin tu yongs su dag cing phun sum tshogs pa'i bsnyen gnas yan lag brgyad pa ma bsrungs pas da ltar sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu rnams dang skal ba mnyam par
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / dge slong dag sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu 'di snyam du bdag sngon mir gyur pa na shin tu yongs su dag cing phun sum tshogs pa'i bsnyen gnas yan lag brgyad pa ma bsrungs pas da ltar sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu rnams dang skal ba mnyam par
translated: Why is that?🔽Monks, the nāgas born from eggs think, ‘In the past, when I was a human, I did not observe the poṣadha of the eightfold precepts, which is extremely pure and perfect.🔽Now I have been born with the same fortune as the nāgas born from eggs.

original: skyes so // gal te bdag sngon mir gyur pa na shin tu dag cing phun sum tshogs pa'i gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa dang bcas na /
analyzed: skyes so // gal te bdag sngon mir gyur pa na shin tu dag cing phun sum tshogs pa'i gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa dang bcas na /
translated: If I had observed the poṣadha of the eightfold precepts, which is extremely pure and perfect,

original: bdag nga ltar sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nga ltar sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: I will not be reborn with the fortune of being a nāga born from an egg like me.

original: de lta bas na bdag sngon mir gyur pa na phun sum tshogs shing shin tu yongs su dag pa'i gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa ma bsrungs pas da ltar bdag sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skyes so snyam du sems so zhes
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag sngon mir gyur pa na phun sum tshogs shing shin tu yongs su dag pa'i gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa ma bsrungs pas da ltar bdag sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skyes so snyam du sems so zhes
translated: Therefore, I previously, as a human, did not guard the perfect and very pure eight-limbed upavāsa. Now I am reborn with the fortune of being a nāga born from an egg.”

original: gsungs so // sgo nga las skyes pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gsungs so // sgo nga las skyes pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with those born from eggs, so it is for those born from a womb, those born from heat and moisture, and those born supernaturally.

analyzed: de ni mdo las 'byung @227b ba'i las rnams bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i las rnams bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsum tshan gsum pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa'i lhag ma las bstan pa 'chad pa po nyid kyis ji ltar rigs par mdo las nye bar bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: are explained by the teacher himself in the sutra, as appropriate.

original: de yang 'di skad du 'don te /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du 'don te /
translated: They are recited as follows:

original: yon skyon snyigs ma snyigs ma can //
analyzed: yon skyon snyigs ma snyigs ma can //
translated: Faults, virtues, dregs, and dregs-possessors,🔽three kinds of bad conduct,🔽purity, asceticism, body, merit, non-merit,

original: nyes par spyad pa rnam gsum dang // gtsang thub lus bsod bsod min dang // 'das sogs bde gshegs gsal bar mdzad //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa rnam gsum dang // gtsang thub lus bsod bsod min dang // 'das sogs bde gshegs gsal bar mdzad //
translated: and the Sugata's illumination of the past, etc.🔽The three realms, the three intentions,

analyzed: gnas gsum gyis ni bsdus pa dang // ched du bsam brjod gsum dag dang // las rnams gsum dang 'das dang dge //
translated: the three expressions, the three karmas, the past, and virtue,

analyzed: slob dang mthong dang 'dod dag gzugs //
translated: the learner, the seen, the desire realm, and form.🔽Happiness in this life, mental satisfaction, suffering,🔽and wrong view are the small objects to be abandoned,

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde ba dang // yid bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang // log lta spang bya chung ngu dang // ser sna dang ni ser sna med //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde ba dang // yid bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang // log lta spang bya chung ngu dang // ser sna dang ni ser sna med //
translated: miserliness and non-miserliness,

original: brnab sems brnab sems med pa dag //
analyzed: brnab sems brnab sems med pa dag //
translated: Covetousness and the absence of covetousness,

original: tshogs su yang dag bsdebs pa yin ;
analyzed: tshogs su yang dag bsdebs pa yin ;
translated: are combined in a group.

original: / yon po ni rnam pa gsum ste //
analyzed: / yon po ni rnam pa gsum ste //
translated: Dishonesty is threefold:

original: lus kyi yon po dang / ngag gi yon po dang / yid kyi yon po'o //
analyzed: lus kyi yon po dang / ngag gi yon po dang / yid kyi yon po'o //
translated: dishonesty of body, dishonesty of speech, and dishonesty of mind.

original: skyon ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: skyon ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Fault is threefold:

original: lus kyi skyon dang / ngag gi skyon dang / yid kyi skyon no //
analyzed: lus kyi skyon dang / ngag gi skyon dang / yid kyi skyon no //
translated: fault of body, fault of speech, and fault of mind.

original: snyigs ma can ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: snyigs ma can ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Filth is threefold:

original: lus kyi snyigs ma can dang / ngag gi snyigs ma can dang / yid kyi snyigs ma can no //
analyzed: lus kyi snyigs ma can dang / ngag gi snyigs ma can dang / yid kyi snyigs ma can no //
translated: filth of body, filth of speech, and filth of mind.

original: snyigs ma ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: snyigs ma ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Defilement is threefold:

original: lus kyi snyigs ma dang / ngag gi snyigs ma dang / yid kyi snyigs ma rnams so //
analyzed: lus kyi snyigs ma dang / ngag gi snyigs ma dang / yid kyi snyigs ma rnams so //
translated: defilement of body, defilement of speech, and defilement of mind.

original: nyes par spyad pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Bad conduct is threefold:

original: 'dod chags kyi nyes par spyod pa dang / zhe sdong  gi nyes par spyod pa dang / gti mug gi nyes par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi nyes par spyod pa dang / zhe sdong  gi nyes par spyod pa dang / gti mug gi nyes par spyod pa'o //
translated: bad conduct born of attachment, bad conduct born of hatred, and bad conduct born of confusion.

original: gtsang byed ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gtsang byed ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Purification is threefold:

original: lus gtsang byed dang / ngag gtsang byed dang / yid gtsang byed do //
analyzed: lus gtsang byed dang / ngag gtsang byed dang / yid gtsang byed do //
translated: The purification of body, the purification of speech, and the purification of mind.

original: thub pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: thub pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three kinds of sages:

original: lus thub pa dang / ngag thub pa dang / yid thub pa'o //
analyzed: lus thub pa dang / ngag thub pa dang / yid thub pa'o //
translated: the sage of body, the sage of speech, and the sage of mind.

original: 'du byed ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'du byed ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three kinds of volitional formations:

original: lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed do //
translated: volitional formations of body, volitional formations of speech, and volitional formations of mind.

original: 'du byed rnam pa gsum las chos rnams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed bshad pa /
analyzed: 'du byed rnam pa gsum las chos rnams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed bshad pa /
translated: The three kinds of volitional formations are explained as the volitional formations that lead to the various phenomena.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa nyan thos 'di na 'di ltar slob ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa nyan thos 'di na 'di ltar slob ste /
translated: Moreover, noble disciples train like this:

original: gzugs gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ste /🔽'byung ba @228a * //
analyzed: gzugs gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ste / 'byung ba @228a * //
translated: Whatever form there is, all of it is the four great elements and what is derived from the four great elements.🔽The four great elements are impermanent, conditioned, dependently arisen, and arisen from what is accumulated.

original: chen po bzhi gang yin pa de yang mi rtag pa 'dus byas pa bsams pas bsgrubs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin no zhes rig nas mi g-yo ba la mos pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: chen po bzhi gang yin pa de yang mi rtag pa 'dus byas pa bsams pas bsgrubs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin no zhes rig nas mi g-yo ba la mos pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: Having understood this, they become devoted to the unshakable.

original: de de ltar rtogs nas de la lan mang du bsgrubs shing gnas so //
analyzed: de de ltar rtogs nas de la lan mang du bsgrubs shing gnas so //
translated: Having understood it in this way, he practices it many times and abides in it.

original: skye mched la sems mngon par dang ste /
analyzed: skye mched la sems mngon par dang ste /
translated: His mind is clear with regard to the sense-spheres.

original: sems mngon par dang bas da ltar 'phags pa nyan thos mi g-yo ba la snyoms par 'jug cing shes rab rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems mngon par dang bas da ltar 'phags pa nyan thos mi g-yo ba la snyoms par 'jug cing shes rab rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: With a clear mind, he enters into the absorption of the noble śrāvaka’s unshakable state and becomes liberated through wisdom.

original: gang zhig bsgrubs pas rnam par shes pa mi g-yo bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas yod cing skabs yod de /
analyzed: gang zhig bsgrubs pas rnam par shes pa mi g-yo bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas yod cing skabs yod de /
translated: It is possible and there is an occasion for him to practice in such a way that his consciousness becomes unshakable.

original: 'di ni mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i las gnyis pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i las gnyis pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second teaching on the karma that leads to the unshakable state.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa nyan thos 'di ni 'di ltar yang dag par so sor slob ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa nyan thos 'di ni 'di ltar yang dag par so sor slob ste /
translated: Moreover, this noble disciple trains himself correctly in the following way:

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / pha rol gyi 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi gzugs gang yin pa dang / pha rol gyi gzugs gang yin pa dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi 'dod pa'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / pha rol gyi 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi gzugs gang yin pa dang / pha rol gyi gzugs gang yin pa dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi 'dod pa'i 'du shes dang /
translated: Whatever desires there are in this life, whatever desires there are in the next life, whatever forms there are in this life, whatever forms there are in the next life, the perception of desire in this life,

original: pha rol gyi 'dod pa'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi gzugs kyi 'du shes dang / pha rol gyi gzugs kyi 'du shes 'di dag ni mi rtag pa 'dus byas pa bsams pas bsgrubs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin no zhes rig nas mi g-yo ba la mos pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'dod pa'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi gzugs kyi 'du shes dang / pha rol gyi gzugs kyi 'du shes 'di dag ni mi rtag pa 'dus byas pa bsams pas bsgrubs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin no zhes rig nas mi g-yo ba la mos pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: The perception of the other’s desire, the perception of the form of the present world, and the perception of the other’s form are impermanent, conditioned, and dependently arisen.
