translated: has taught the path that leads to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: nye bar len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' ba yang bstan lags kyi /
analyzed: nye bar len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' ba yang bstan lags kyi /
translated: and has taught the attainment of nirvāṇa without clinging.

original: bcun pa 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam bstan du gsol //
analyzed: bcun pa 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam bstan du gsol //
translated: Lord, please teach the path of the noble ones’ liberation.

original: kun dga' bo 'di ni dge slong 'di ltar so sor yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ni dge slong 'di ltar so sor yang dag par slob ste /
translated: “Ānanda, this monk trains in this way:

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / pha rol gyi 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi gzugs gang yin pa dang / pha rol gyi gzugs gang yin pa dang ; mthong ba'i chos kyi 'dod pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / pha rol gyi 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi gzugs gang yin pa dang / pha rol gyi gzugs gang yin pa dang ; mthong ba'i chos kyi 'dod pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa dang /
translated: Whatever is desired in this life, whatever is desired in the next life, whatever form is in this life, whatever form is in the next life, whatever perception of desire is in this life,

original: pha rol gyi 'dod pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi gzugs kyi 'du shes gang yin pa dang / pha rol gyi gzugs kyi 'du shes gang yin pa dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched gang yin pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched gang yin pa 'di tsam ni 'jig tshogs te /
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'dod pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi gzugs kyi 'du shes gang yin pa dang / pha rol gyi gzugs kyi 'du shes gang yin pa dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched gang yin pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched gang yin pa 'di tsam ni 'jig tshogs te /
translated: whatever perception of desire is in the next life, whatever perception of form is in this life, whatever perception of form is in the next life, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception—this much is the perishing collection.

original: ji tsam du 'jig tshogs gang yin pa de tsam du skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji tsam du 'jig tshogs gang yin pa de tsam du skye bar 'gyur /
translated: To the extent that there is a perishing collection, to that extent there is birth.

original: na bar 'gyur /
analyzed: na bar 'gyur /
translated: There is sickness.

original: rga bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rga bar 'gyur /
translated: There is aging.

original: 'chi 'pho zhing skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho zhing skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: There is death and rebirth.

original: 'di 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called death.

original: 'chi ba med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is immortality?

original: nye bar lan pa spangs pa nges par byung ba /
analyzed: nye bar lan pa spangs pa nges par byung ba /
translated: The abandonment of the appropriating aggregates is definite emergence.

original: sred pa zad pa 'dogs chags dang bral ba 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa zad pa 'dogs chags dang bral ba 'gog pa ste /
translated: The exhaustion of craving is freedom from attachment and cessation.

original: kun dga' bo ngas 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i lam bstan cing ci yang med pa'i skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lam yang bstan cing 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lam yang bstan
analyzed: kun dga' bo ngas 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i lam bstan cing ci yang med pa'i skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lam yang bstan cing 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lam yang bstan
translated: Ānanda, I have taught the path that leads to the noble discipline of the Dharma, the path that leads to the sphere of nothingness, and the path that leads to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: / nye bar len pa med pa mya ngan las 'das pa bstan cing /
analyzed: / nye bar len pa med pa mya ngan las 'das pa bstan cing /
translated: I have taught the absence of appropriation and nirvāṇa.

original: 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba yang bstan te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba yang bstan te /
translated: I have taught the noble liberation.

original: kun dga' bo 'di ni ston pas dge slong rnams la bya ba byed /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ni ston pas dge slong rnams la bya ba byed /
translated: Ānanda, this is what the Teacher does for the monks.

original: thugs rje dang rjes su brtse bas don du 'dod pa dang phan par 'dod de bdag gis byas so //
analyzed: thugs rje dang rjes su brtse bas don du 'dod pa dang phan par 'dod de bdag gis byas so //
translated: With compassion and love, I have done what is wished for and what is beneficial.”

original: da ni khyed @230b cag rnams kyis bya ba dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khang pa stong pa dang / ri dang ri'i phug dang / sog ma'i spyil bu dang / bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod dang nags dag tu mal stan rnying pa dag la dge slong dag bsam gtan bya zhing bag med par mi bya ste /
analyzed: da ni khyed @230b cag rnams kyis bya ba dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khang pa stong pa dang / ri dang ri'i phug dang / sog ma'i spyil bu dang / bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod dang nags dag tu mal stan rnying pa dag la dge slong dag bsam gtan bya zhing bag med par mi bya ste /
translated: Now, you monks should practice meditation in old beds in monasteries, at the foot of trees, in empty houses, in mountains, mountain caves, thatched huts, in the open, in charnel grounds, and in forests. Do not be heedless.

original: phyis 'gyod par gyur ta re /
analyzed: phyis 'gyod par gyur ta re /
translated: Later, you will regret it.

original: 'di nga'i rjes su bstan pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nga'i rjes su bstan pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is my instruction.

original: bar sdom la /
analyzed: bar sdom la /
translated: The summary:

original: mi rtag rnam gsum bdag dang cung zad med /
analyzed: mi rtag rnam gsum bdag dang cung zad med /
translated: Impermanence in three ways, selflessness, not the slightest,

original: mthong chos bdag dang lta dang ji tsam bstan //
analyzed: mthong chos bdag dang lta dang ji tsam bstan //
translated: what is seen, self, views, and as much as taught.

original: de la mdo dang pos ni bsam gtan gyi lam bstan cing /
analyzed: de la mdo dang pos ni bsam gtan gyi lam bstan cing /
translated: In the first discourse, the path of meditation is taught.

original: mdo gnyis pa la sogs pas ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo gnyis pa la sogs pas ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the second discourse and so on, the formless absorptions are taught.

original: mig gi gzugs rnams mthong nas gzugs la so sor yang dag par rtog par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig gi gzugs rnams mthong nas gzugs la so sor yang dag par rtog par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having seen forms with the eye, one should thoroughly investigate forms.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The frame story is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag rnam grangs gang gis rnam grangs gang la brten te dge slong dad pa gzhan du gyur cing /
analyzed: dge slong dag rnam grangs gang gis rnam grangs gang la brten te dge slong dad pa gzhan du gyur cing /
translated: “Monks, is there a way in which a monk, on the basis of a certain way of teaching the Dharma, would have faith in another,

original: 'dod pa yang gzhan du /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang gzhan du /
translated: but would have a different desire,

original: thos pa yang gzhan du rnam pa yongs su spyod pa yang gzhan du mthong ba'i bsam gtan la bzod pa yang gzhan du gyur la /
analyzed: thos pa yang gzhan du rnam pa yongs su spyod pa yang gzhan du mthong ba'i bsam gtan la bzod pa yang gzhan du gyur la /
translated: a different hearing, a different aspect, a different practice, a different patience, a different meditation,🔽and would declare, ‘I do not know anything else apart from this existence’?”

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes yang dag pa nyid du lung ston pa de lta bu yod dam /
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes yang dag pa nyid du lung ston pa de lta bu yod dam /
translated: “Yes, Venerable Blessed One.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rtsa ba /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rtsa ba /
translated: Blessed One, the root of the Dharma,

original: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi spyan zhes bya ba nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar du'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi spyan zhes bya ba nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar du'o //
translated: Blessed One, what is called the eye of the Dharma, up to ‘should be taught.’

original: dge slong dag rnam grangs gang gis rnam grangs gang la brten te dge slong dad pa gzhan du gyur cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag rnam grangs gang gis rnam grangs gang la brten te dge slong dad pa gzhan du gyur cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Monks, is there a way in which a monk, on the basis of a certain way of teaching the Dharma, would have faith in another, and so on, up to🔽“Yes, Venerable Blessed One.

original: snga ma bzhin du srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes yang dag pa nyid du lung bstan pa de lta bu yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes yang dag pa nyid du lung bstan pa de lta bu yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As before, he does not know of any other existence than this one.

original: dge slong dag rnam grangs gang gis rnam grangs gang la brten te zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes yang dag pa nyid du lung ston par 'gyur ba de gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag rnam grangs gang gis rnam grangs gang la brten te zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes yang dag pa nyid du lung ston par 'gyur ba de gang zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what is the category by which a monk, in dependence on a category, will be able to give a correct exposition of the Dharma?

original: dge slong dag 'di ni dge slong mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas gzugs la so sor yang dag par rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni dge slong mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas gzugs la so sor yang dag par rtog par byed kyi /
translated: Monks, a monk sees forms with the eye, but he does not conceive of forms as forms,

original: gzugs rnams la 'dod chags par yang dag par so sor rtog par ni mi byed de /
analyzed: gzugs rnams la 'dod chags par yang dag par so sor rtog par ni mi byed de /
translated: nor does he conceive of forms as attractive or unattractive.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs rnams la chags pa med cing nang gi @231a * //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs rnams la chags pa med cing nang gi @231a * //
translated: The eye consciousness that arises internally is free from attachment to forms, and the eye consciousness that arises internally is free from aversion to forms.

original: bdag nyid kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs rnams la chags pa med do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs rnams la chags pa med do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows perfectly and just as it is: ‘My eye consciousness is not attached to visible forms.’

original: dge slong dag 'di na dge slong rna bas sgra la /🔽snas dri la /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di na dge slong rna bas sgra la / snas dri la /
translated: “Monks, in this case, a monk, having heard sounds with the ear,

original: lces ro la /
analyzed: lces ro la /
translated: having smelled scents with the nose,🔽having tasted flavors with the tongue,

original: lus kyis reg bya la /
analyzed: lus kyis reg bya la /
translated: having felt touchable things with the body,

original: yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes nas chos la so sor yang dag par rtog par byed kyi //
analyzed: yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes nas chos la so sor yang dag par rtog par byed kyi //
translated: having cognized mental phenomena with the mind, he discerns mental phenomena,

original: chos la 'dod chags par so sor yang dag par rtog par mi byed de /🔽nang gi bdag nyid kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos rnams la chags pa med cing /
analyzed: chos la 'dod chags par so sor yang dag par rtog par mi byed de / nang gi bdag nyid kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos rnams la chags pa med cing /
translated: but he does not discern mental phenomena with attachment.🔽He knows perfectly and just as it is: ‘My inner mind consciousness is not attached to mental phenomena.’

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos rnams la chags pa med do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos rnams la chags pa med do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows perfectly and just as it is: ‘My inner mind consciousness is not attached to mental phenomena.’

original: gang yang dge slong de mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang yang dge slong de mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Moreover, monks, when that monk sees visible forms with the eye,

original: snga ma bzhin du srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes yang dag pa nyid du lung ston par 'gyur ba yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes yang dag pa nyid du lung ston par 'gyur ba yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: As before, I do not know of any other existence apart from this one.”🔽“

original: gang yang dge slong de rna bas sgra nas snga ma bzhin du yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes nas chos so sor yang dag par rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: gang yang dge slong de rna bas sgra nas snga ma bzhin du yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes nas chos so sor yang dag par rtog par byed kyi /
translated: When a monk, having heard sounds with the ear, as before, up to having cognized mental phenomena with the mind, discerns mental phenomena,

original: chos la 'dod chags par so sor yang dag par rtog par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos la 'dod chags par so sor yang dag par rtog par mi byed de /
translated: he does not discern mental phenomena with desire.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos rnams la chags pa med cing /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos rnams la chags pa med cing /
translated: The inner mental consciousness is not attached to mental phenomena.🔽The inner mental consciousness is not attached to mental phenomena.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos rnams la chags pa med do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes na /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos rnams la chags pa med do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes na /
translated: If he knows this as it really is,

original: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: monks, what do you think?

original: chos 'di dad pa dang / 'dod pa dang / thos pa dang / rnam pa yongs su dpyod pa dang / mthong ba'i bsam gtan la bzod pas rig par bya ba yan snyam mam /
analyzed: chos 'di dad pa dang / 'dod pa dang / thos pa dang / rnam pa yongs su dpyod pa dang / mthong ba'i bsam gtan la bzod pas rig par bya ba yan snyam mam /
translated: Is this Dharma to be known through faith, desire, hearing, thorough analysis of the aspects, or through the concentration of seeing?

original: btsun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: “No, Venerable.”

original: chos 'di ni yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong zhing rig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong zhing rig par bya ba yin no //
translated: “This Dharma is to be known through seeing and understanding it with right wisdom just as it is.”

original: btsun pa de bzhin no //🔽dge slong dag 'di ni rnam grangs gang gis dang rnam grangs gang la brten nas dad pa yang gzhan du zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: btsun pa de bzhin no // dge slong dag 'di ni rnam grangs gang gis dang rnam grangs gang la brten nas dad pa yang gzhan du zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Yes, Venerable.”

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes yang dag pa nyid du lung ston pa zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes yang dag pa nyid du lung ston pa zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Monks, this is the way and the basis by which faith is different from the other, as before, up to ‘I do not know any other existence beyond this one.’ This is called ‘giving a correct answer.’”

original: gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba de'i tshe zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba de'i tshe zhes bya ba la /
translated: When one experiences a pleasant feeling, at that time…

original: gang las nye bar bstan ce na /
analyzed: gang las nye bar bstan ce na /
translated: From where is this taught?

original: gleng gzhi ni chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las @231b 'don te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las @231b 'don te /
translated: The context is from the Great Dharma Discourse.

original: kun dga' bo ji tsam gyis na bdag nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing bdag nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong ba zhes bya /
analyzed: kun dga' bo ji tsam gyis na bdag nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing bdag nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong ba zhes bya /
translated: “Ānanda, to what extent does one see oneself and say, ‘I see myself’?

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi rtsa ba /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi rtsa ba /
translated: “Honored One, Blessed One, the root of phenomena

original: bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi spyan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi spyan te /
translated: is the Blessed One, the eye of phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong rnams don 'di bstan na dge slong rnams kyis thos nas legs par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong rnams don 'di bstan na dge slong rnams kyis thos nas legs par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Blessed One, if the monks are taught this meaning, the monks will learn it well.”

original: kun dga' bo de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: “Ānanda, for that reason listen well and keep it in mind. I will explain it.

original: kun dga' bo 'di ni tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ni tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: “Ānanda, this is how one sees and sees correctly that ‘feeling is the self.’

original: kun dga' bo gzhan yang 'di na kha cig tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong mod kyi /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gzhan yang 'di na kha cig tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong mod kyi /
translated: “Ānanda, moreover, in this case, some do not see ‘feeling is the self’ and see correctly.

original: 'on kyang bdag ni rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag ni rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: But I am one who is aware and experiences.

original: kun dga' bo gzhan yang 'di na kha cig tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing bdag ni rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong mod kyi 'on kyang bdag ni so sor myong ba ma
analyzed: kun dga' bo gzhan yang 'di na kha cig tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing bdag ni rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong mod kyi 'on kyang bdag ni so sor myong ba ma
translated: “Moreover, Ānanda, in this regard, some do not see that feeling is the self, and they do not see that the self is one who is aware and experiences. However, they do see that the self is not one who experiences.

original: yin pa'o zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
analyzed: yin pa'o zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
translated: They do not see that the self is not one who experiences.

original: kun dga' bo de la tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de la 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de la tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de la 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: “Ānanda, in this regard, those who see that feeling is the self and who see that the self is one who is aware and experiences should be addressed as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
translated: ‘Venerable ones, feeling is threefold:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba de'i tshe tshor ba gnyis po sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dag 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba de'i tshe tshor ba gnyis po sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dag 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Venerable friends, when you experience a pleasant feeling, at that time two feelings — unpleasant feeling and neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling — cease.

original: khyod gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba na bde ba'i tshor ba de yang mi rtag ste /🔽'gag pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: khyod gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba na bde ba'i tshor ba de yang mi rtag ste / 'gag pa'i chos can te /
translated: Venerable friends, when you experience a pleasant feeling, that pleasant feeling is impermanent, it is conditioned, it is dependently originated, it is corruptible, it is liable to destruction, it is liable to vanish, it is not recognized as being yours, and it is not recognized as being the self.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba 'gags pa na bdag dang bral zhing bdag 'ong ba med par gyur tam ci //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba 'gags pa na bdag dang bral zhing bdag 'ong ba med par gyur tam ci //
translated: When that pleasant feeling ceases, is it recognized as being yours, or as being the self?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba de'i tshe tshor ba gnyis po bde ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dag 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba de'i tshe tshor ba gnyis po bde ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dag 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Venerable friends, when you experience an unpleasant feeling, at that time two feelings — pleasant feeling and neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling — cease.

original: khyod gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong ba na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de yang mi @232a * //🔽rtag cing 'gag pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: khyod gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong ba na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de yang mi @232a * // rtag cing 'gag pa'i chos can te /
translated: When you experience a painful feeling, that painful feeling is impermanent and subject to cessation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'gags pa na bdag dang bral zhing bdag 'ong ba med par gyur tam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'gags pa na bdag dang bral zhing bdag 'ong ba med par gyur tam /
translated: When the painful feeling ceases, is it separated from you and does not come back?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang gi tshe bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba de'i tshe tshor ba gnyis po bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gnyis po dag 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang gi tshe bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba de'i tshe tshor ba gnyis po bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gnyis po dag 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Venerable friends, when you experience a neither painful nor pleasant feeling, at that time the two feelings, the pleasant feeling and the painful feeling, have ceased.

original: khyod gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba na bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba de yang mi rtag cing 'gag pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: khyod gang gi tshe bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba na bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba de yang mi rtag cing 'gag pa'i chos can te /
translated: When you experience a pleasant feeling, that neither painful nor pleasant feeling is impermanent and subject to cessation.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba 'gags pa na bdag dang bral zhing 'ong ba med par gyur tam zhes so //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba 'gags pa na bdag dang bral zhing 'ong ba med par gyur tam zhes so //
translated: When the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant ceases, does it come back to me and not depart?

original: kun dga' bo 'di ji snyam du sems //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ji snyam du sems //
translated: Ānanda, what do you think?

original: de 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'dres shing 'chol ba'i tshor ba myong ba la tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de dge 'am /
analyzed: de 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'dres shing 'chol ba'i tshor ba myong ba la tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de dge 'am /
translated: When one sees that feeling is mixed and confused with pleasure and pain, is it proper to say that feeling is the self?

original: btsun pa ma lags so //🔽kun dga' bo rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su lta zhing yang dag par rjes su lta ba 'di ni ngas mi bzod do //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so // kun dga' bo rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su lta zhing yang dag par rjes su lta ba 'di ni ngas mi bzod do //
translated: No, Lord.🔽Ānanda, I do not accept that it is proper to regard feeling as the self.

original: kun dga' bo de la kha cig tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong mod kyi 'on kyang bdag ni rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes yang dag par rjes su lta zhing yang dag par rjes su lta ba de la 'di
analyzed: kun dga' bo de la kha cig tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong mod kyi 'on kyang bdag ni rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes yang dag par rjes su lta zhing yang dag par rjes su lta ba de la 'di
translated: Ānanda, some people do not regard feeling as the self, but they do regard the self as something that has awareness and feeling.

original: skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: This will be explained.

original: gang yang tshor ba med ba de lta tshor ba bo mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang yang tshor ba med ba de lta tshor ba bo mi dmigs so //
translated: If there is no feeling, then a feeler is not apprehended.

original: kun dga' bo gang tshor ba med pa de la tshor ba po mi dmigs na bdag ni rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes smra ba de dag dge ba yin nam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gang tshor ba med pa de la tshor ba po mi dmigs na bdag ni rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes smra ba de dag dge ba yin nam /
translated: Ānanda, if there is no feeling, then a feeler is not apprehended. Are those who say, “I am a being who is aware and feels,” virtuous?

original: btsun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: “No, Lord.”

original: kun dga' bo rnam grangs 'dis na bdag rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes yang dag par rjes su lta ba 'di ni ngas mi bzod do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo rnam grangs 'dis na bdag rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes yang dag par rjes su lta ba 'di ni ngas mi bzod do //
translated: “Ānanda, I do not accept that those who see in this way, ‘I am a being who is aware and feels,’ are virtuous.

original: kun dga' bo de la tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de la tshor ba bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
translated: Ānanda, in this regard, they do not see in this way, ‘Feeling is the self.’

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
translated: They do not see in this way,🔽‘I am a being who is aware and feels.’

original: bdag ni rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes yang dag par rjes su lta ba 'di ni ngas mi bzod rjes su mi mthong mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni rig cing tshor ba'i chos can no zhes yang dag par rjes su lta ba 'di ni ngas mi bzod rjes su mi mthong mod kyi /
translated: “Ānanda, in this regard, they do not see in this way, ‘Feeling is the self.’

original: 'on kyang bdag ni so sor myong ba med pa'o zhes yang dag par rjes su lta zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag ni so sor myong ba med pa'o zhes yang dag par rjes su lta zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: But when one sees and knows that the self is not a separate experiencer, then one should say to him:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang la tshor ba @232b po mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gang la tshor ba @232b po mi dmigs so //
translated: “Venerable Ones, where feeling is not apprehended, there the experiencer is not apprehended.

original: kun dga' bo gang la tshor ba med pa de la tshor ba po mi dmigs kyang bdag ces bya bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gang la tshor ba med pa de la tshor ba po mi dmigs kyang bdag ces bya bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Ānanda, where feeling does not exist, there the experiencer is not apprehended. But would the self be that?”

original: btsun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: “No, Venerable One.”

original: kun dga' bo bdag tu rlom pa thams cad du mi bden na bdag ni so sor rig pa med pa'o zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ba na dge ba yin nam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo bdag tu rlom pa thams cad du mi bden na bdag ni so sor rig pa med pa'o zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ba na dge ba yin nam /
translated: “Ānanda, if all self-postulations are false, then when one sees and knows that the self is not a separate experiencer, is that wholesome?”

original: btsun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: “No, Venerable One.”

original: kun dga' bo rnam grangs 'dis na bdag ni so sor rig pa med pa'o zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ba 'di ni ngas mi bzod do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo rnam grangs 'dis na bdag ni so sor rig pa med pa'o zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ba 'di ni ngas mi bzod do //
translated: “Ānanda, by this method, when one sees and knows that the self is not a separate experiencer, I do not accept that.”

original: kun dga' bo 'di tsam gyis na bdag yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di tsam gyis na bdag yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Ānanda, it is in this way that one sees the self and is said to see correctly.

original: ji ltar dge slong gi dge 'dun la bud med ces brjod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar dge slong gi dge 'dun la bud med ces brjod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is it that the Saṅgha of monks is called a woman?

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung koo sh'amb'i ba'i dge slong rnams kyis lan gsum gyi bar du phyir bzlog pa dang / de'i tshe dge slong rnams kyis the tshom thams cad gcod par mdzad pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung koo sh'amb'i ba'i dge slong rnams kyis lan gsum gyi bar du phyir bzlog pa dang / de'i tshe dge slong rnams kyis the tshom thams cad gcod par mdzad pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: When the monks of Kauśāmbī turned back the Blessed One’s words three times, the monks asked the Blessed Buddha, who cuts through all doubts,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas phrin las ci zhig mdzad nas las de'i rnam par smin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge ba'i gsungs /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas phrin las ci zhig mdzad nas las de'i rnam par smin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge ba'i gsungs /
translated: “Thus-Gone One, what action did you perform that ripened into the Blessed One’s words being turned back by the monks of Kauśāmbī three times, and into his words of virtue,

original: phan pa'i gsung /
analyzed: phan pa'i gsung /
translated: words of benefit,

original: gzung bar 'os pa'i tshig dag kyang koo sh'amb'i ba'i dge slong rnams kyis lan gsum gyi bar du phyir bzlog / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gzung bar 'os pa'i tshig dag kyang koo sh'amb'i ba'i dge slong rnams kyis lan gsum gyi bar du phyir bzlog / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and words worth hearing being turned back by the monks of Kauśāmbī three times?” The Blessed One said,🔽“Monks, the actions were performed and accumulated by the Thus-Gone One himself in other lives in the past, arising from causes that were accumulated and stored up.

original: dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis te /
translated: “Monks, the Tathāgata himself,🔽in the past, when he was an ordinary person, did this action or accumulated it.

original: sngon gzhan gyis byas shing bsags pa dag gzhan su zhig gis nyams su myong par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sngon gzhan gyis byas shing bsags pa dag gzhan su zhig gis nyams su myong par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Who else will experience the results?

original: lus can rnams la 'bras bur smin ;
analyzed: lus can rnams la 'bras bur smin ;
translated: The results will be experienced by the one who did the action,

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: by the one who accumulated it.”

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: “Monks, in the past, in times gone by, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha Aparājita, who was learned and virtuous,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a blissful one,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽bla na med pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa / bla na med pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: a charioteer who guides human beings to be tamed,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma pham pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma pham pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans, a blessed buddha, appeared in the world.

original: de'i tshe na nga byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod de phyug po'i bur gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na nga byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod de phyug po'i bur gyur te /
translated: At that time, I was practicing bodhisattva conduct and was the son of a wealthy man.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing rab tu byung ngo //🔽rab @233a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing rab tu byung ngo // rab @233a * //
translated: He generated the mind of awakening and went forth.

original: tu byung nas sde snod gsum par gyur to //
analyzed: tu byung nas sde snod gsum par gyur to //
translated: After going forth, he became a master of the three baskets.

original: de nas dge slong gi dge 'dun la rtsod pa byung ste /
analyzed: de nas dge slong gi dge 'dun la rtsod pa byung ste /
translated: Then a dispute arose in the community of monks.

original: des rtsod pa de cher 'phel bar byas so //
analyzed: des rtsod pa de cher 'phel bar byas so //
translated: He made the dispute grow even more.

original: ji tsam na dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa zhig gis de bton nas rtsod pa de zhi bar byas pa dang / des bud med rnams kyi rtsod pa zhi bar byas sam zhes dge slong gi dge 'dun la bud med ces smras so //
analyzed: ji tsam na dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa zhig gis de bton nas rtsod pa de zhi bar byas pa dang / des bud med rnams kyi rtsod pa zhi bar byas sam zhes dge slong gi dge 'dun la bud med ces smras so //
translated: Then a monk who was a master of the sūtras recited the sūtras and settled the dispute. He said to the community of monks, “Did you settle the dispute of the women?”

original: ngag gi nyes par spyad pa des de'i skyes pa'i dbang po nub cing bud med kyi dbang po byung bar gyur cing skye ba lnga brgyar bud med du skyes shing yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin chen gtsug tor can gyis de'i bud med kyi dngos po
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyad pa des de'i skyes pa'i dbang po nub cing bud med kyi dbang po byung bar gyur cing skye ba lnga brgyar bud med du skyes shing yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin chen gtsug tor can gyis de'i bud med kyi dngos po
translated: Because of that verbal misdeed, his male organ disappeared and a female organ appeared. He was born as a woman for five hundred lifetimes. The Completely Awakened One Ratnaśikhin reversed his female state

original: bzlog cing skyes pa'i dngos po thob par byas so //
analyzed: bzlog cing skyes pa'i dngos po thob par byas so //
translated: and caused him to obtain a male state.

original: nga nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na phyug po'i bur gyur cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sde snod gsum par gyur kyang ngas dge 'dun la ngag gi nyes par spyod pa smras pas las de'i rgyus koo sh'amb'i dge slong rnams kyis lan gsum gyi🔽bar du nga'i tshig phyir bzlog go //
analyzed: nga nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na phyug po'i bur gyur cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sde snod gsum par gyur kyang ngas dge 'dun la ngag gi nyes par spyod pa smras pas las de'i rgyus koo sh'amb'i dge slong rnams kyis lan gsum gyi bar du nga'i tshig phyir bzlog go //
translated: At that time, I was the son of a rich man, practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva. I was a Tripiṭaka master, but because I spoke harshly to the saṅgha, because of that karma, the monks of Kauśāmbī turned back my words three times.

original: 'di nyid phran tshegs las sangs rgyas mang po'i rtogs pa brjod par tshigs su bcad par byas te /
analyzed: 'di nyid phran tshegs las sangs rgyas mang po'i rtogs pa brjod par tshigs su bcad par byas te /
translated: This very story is made into a verse in the Kṣudraka-āgama of many buddhas.

original: de nas sangs rgyas mi pham pa'i //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas mi pham pa'i //
translated: Then, the Buddha Ajita

original: sdon byung sde snod gsum par gyur //
analyzed: sdon byung sde snod gsum par gyur //
translated: was formerly a Tripiṭaka master.

original: dge slong dge 'dun rtsod pa na //
analyzed: dge slong dge 'dun rtsod pa na //
translated: When the monks of the saṅgha were arguing,

original: dge 'dun bud med ces brjod pa'i //
analyzed: dge 'dun bud med ces brjod pa'i //
translated: he spoke harshly, saying, “The saṅgha is a woman.”

original: ngag gi nyes par spyad byas pas //
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyad byas pas //
translated: Because of that verbal misdeed,

original: bud med nyid du nye bar song //🔽slar yang sems rab dad pa yis //
analyzed: bud med nyid du nye bar song // slar yang sems rab dad pa yis //
translated: he was reborn as a woman.🔽Then, with a mind of complete faith,

original: skyes pa'i dngos po nyid du gyur //
analyzed: skyes pa'i dngos po nyid du gyur //
translated: he became a man again.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: ji ltar nyung rum zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar nyung rum zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is it that he was called “eunuch”?

original: rgyal po ka na ka'i nyung rum long ba zhes bya ba cig yod do zhes grag ste /
analyzed: rgyal po ka na ka'i nyung rum long ba zhes bya ba cig yod do zhes grag ste /
translated: It is said that there was a king named Kanakavatsa, the Blind One.

original: de lam na 'gro ba na ba lang lnga brgya'i khyu zhig khrid de 'gro ba mthong nas /
analyzed: de lam na 'gro ba na ba lang lnga brgya'i khyu zhig khrid de 'gro ba mthong nas /
translated: While he was traveling on the road, he saw a man leading a herd of five hundred cows.

original: 'di dag ci byed ces dris pa dang / smras pa dbang po dag gdon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ci byed ces dris pa dang / smras pa dbang po dag gdon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He asked, “What are you doing with these?” The man replied, “I am taking them to be slaughtered.”

original: de 'di snyam du bdag kyang sngon byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pas 'di lta bur gyur la /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag kyang sngon byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pas 'di lta bur gyur la /
translated: He thought, “I have become like this because of the ripening of my previous actions.

original: 'di yang 'di lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: 'di yang 'di lta bur gyur te /
translated: This man will also become like this.🔽This man will experience suffering like this for many lifetimes because of the actions he has done.”

original: mi des las 'di byas pas skye ba mang por rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bsam pa'i khyad par drag po mngon du byas nas ba lang nyos te grol bar byas so //
analyzed: mi des las 'di byas pas skye ba mang por rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bsam pa'i khyad par drag po mngon du byas nas ba lang nyos te grol bar byas so //
translated: He made a strong resolution and bought the cows to set them free.

original: de nas nyung rum de'i skyes pa'i dbang po byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas nyung rum de'i skyes pa'i dbang po byung bar gyur to //
translated: Then the genitals of the blind man appeared.

original: rgyal pos thos nas rab tu dga' ste de nyid bud med kyi srung mar gzhag go //
analyzed: rgyal pos thos nas rab tu dga' ste de nyid bud med kyi srung mar gzhag go //
translated: When the king heard about this, he was very pleased and appointed him as the protector of women.

original: ji @233b ltar pi lin ta'i bu'i gtam rgyud ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ji @233b ltar pi lin ta'i bu'i gtam rgyud ces bya ba la /
translated: As in the story of Pilindavatsa.

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom brlag gi aa mra'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom brlag gi aa mra'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying in the mango grove of Mathurā.

original: de'i tshe bram ze mo pi lin ta'i bu drug dus las 'das par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bram ze mo pi lin ta'i bu drug dus las 'das par gyur to //
translated: At that time, the wife of the brahmin Pilindavatsa lost six sons in succession.

original: de de dag dus byas pas sgren mor byung ba ste /
analyzed: de de dag dus byas pas sgren mor byung ba ste /
translated: Because of their deaths, she became naked,

original: smyo zhing sems g-yengs nas de dang der 'khyams zhing bcom pa brlag gi aa mra'i tshal gang na ba der song do //
analyzed: smyo zhing sems g-yengs nas de dang der 'khyams zhing bcom pa brlag gi aa mra'i tshal gang na ba der song do //
translated: and wandering here and there, insane and deranged, she went to the mango grove of Mathurā.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong brgya phrag du ma'i 'khor gyis mdun gyis bltas te chos ston cing bzhugs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong brgya phrag du ma'i 'khor gyis mdun gyis bltas te chos ston cing bzhugs so //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One was seated teaching the Dharma, surrounded by an assembly of many hundreds of monks.

original: bram ze mo pi lin tas thag ring po nas bcom ldan 'das mthong nas ngo tsha zhing 'dzem pa dang bcas pas gzugs bsdus te dran pa rnyed par gyur to //
analyzed: bram ze mo pi lin tas thag ring po nas bcom ldan 'das mthong nas ngo tsha zhing 'dzem pa dang bcas pas gzugs bsdus te dran pa rnyed par gyur to //
translated: The brahmin woman Pilindā saw the Blessed One from a distance, and with shame and embarrassment, she covered her body and regained her composure.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze mo pi lin ta ring po nas gzigs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze mo pi lin ta ring po nas gzigs nas /
translated: The Blessed One saw Pilindā the brahmin woman from a distance,🔽and said to the monks:

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo bram ze mo pi lin ta la bla gos byin te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo bram ze mo pi lin ta la bla gos byin te /
translated: “Ānanda, give your upper robe to the brahmin woman Piliṇḍa.

analyzed: de ltar na gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang gzugs med pas bsdus pa yang mdo las dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba'i las su bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: stong pa nyid chen po'i mdo las zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: dge sbyong dge sbyong mnyam gnyis dang // dmigs bcas yongs shes rjes 'brang dang / chen po bzhi bcu stong nyid gnyis //

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'phags pa nyan thos nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la rang gi sems kyis so sor brtag par bya ste / ci nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag tu 'dun pa'i phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes la ma 'gags shing ring du ma byas pa yod dam /
translated: Because the noble disciple should investigate with his own mind the five appropriated aggregates:🔽“Do I have the negative tendencies of the pride thinking ‘I am’ and the desire thinking ‘I am’ with regard to the five appropriated aggregates that have not been abandoned, not fully understood, not stopped, and not given up?

original: 'on te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di rnams la bdag tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag tu 'dun pa'i phra rgyas ma sbangs shing yongs su ma shes la ma 'gags shing ring du ma byas pa med /

translated: Or do I not have the negative tendencies of the pride thinking ‘I am’ and the desire thinking ‘I am’ with regard to the five appropriated aggregates that have been abandoned, fully understood, stopped, and given up?”

analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong de gal te 'di ltar rang gi sems la so sor rtog par byed pa na /

analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di rnam la bdag tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag tu 'dun pa'i phra @236a * //

original: rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes la ma 'gags shing ring du ma byas pa yod do zhes rnam par shes nas /
analyzed: rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes la ma 'gags shing ring du ma byas pa yod do zhes rnam par shes nas /

original: 'phags pa nyan thos ngas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la skye ba dang 'jig pa yang dag par rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos ngas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la skye ba dang 'jig pa yang dag par rjes su lta zhing gnas te /

original: 'di lta ste 'di ni gzugs /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di ni gzugs /

original: 'di ni gzugs kun 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs kun 'byung ba /

original: 'di ni gzugs 'gag pa /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs 'gag pa /

original: 'di ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed /
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed /

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa /

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba /

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa 'gag pa zhes de nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la skye ba dang 'jig par yang yang dag par rjes su lta zhing gnas pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bdag
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa 'gag pa zhes de nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la skye ba dang 'jig par yang yang dag par rjes su lta zhing gnas pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bdag
translated: In this way, by observing the arising and passing away of the five appropriated aggregates, the pride of self and the pride of mine with regard to the five appropriated aggregates are abandoned.

original: tu 'dun pa'i phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes la ma 'gags shing ring du ma byas pa de 'byung bar ma 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tu 'dun pa'i phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes la ma 'gags shing ring du ma byas pa de 'byung bar ma 'gyur ro //

original: kun dga' bo gal te dge slong 'di ltar rang gi sems la so sor rtog pa shes na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag tu 'du na pa'i phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes la ma 'gags shing ring du ma byas pa med cing /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te dge slong 'di ltar rang gi sems la so sor rtog pa shes na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag tu 'du na pa'i phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes la ma 'gags shing ring du ma byas pa med cing /
translated: Ānanda, if a monk understands how to investigate his own mind, then he will not have the latent tendency of the conceit of self and the latent tendency of the view of self with regard to the five appropriated aggregates that has not been abandoned, not fully understood, not stopped, and not made distant.

original: kun dga' bod de la dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan te chos 'di ni gcig tu dkar ba /
analyzed: kun dga' bod de la dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan te chos 'di ni gcig tu dkar ba /

original: gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med pa /

analyzed: me 'da' zhing bdud sdig pa can gyis yang dag par mi 'phrogs pa /
translated: and the evil Māra cannot overcome it.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos yang srid par nad dang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi bas mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos yang srid par nad dang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi bas mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that the afflicted, sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas are not overcome by rebirth, by the maturation of karma, by suffering, by birth, by aging, and by death.

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba la rab tu byed pa'i rkang pa'i bsdu ba bstan pa'i rab tu byed pa drug pa'i sgo las /🔽nyes sbyar yongs su shes par bya //

original: zhes bya ba las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba las so //

analyzed: nyes par spyad pa ni rnam pa gsum ste ;

analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'o //

analyzed: legs par spyad pa ni rnam pa gsum se /

analyzed: lus kyis legs par spyad pa dang / ngag gis legs par spyad pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa'o //

original: bsags pa'i las mdo las zhes bya ba la /

translated: The sutra says that accumulated karma is

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //

original: 'di dag las thos nas dbye bar gyur cig ces 'di la smras te tshogs 'byed par gyur te /
analyzed: 'di dag las thos nas dbye bar gyur cig ces 'di la smras te tshogs 'byed par gyur te /
translated: They divide the assembly.

original: dad pa dang mi mthun zhing ma dul la rjes su mi mthun pa bas tshig smra zhing phra ma las ma log par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang mi mthun zhing ma dul la rjes su mi mthun pa bas tshig smra zhing phra ma las ma log par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: They speak words that are not in accord with faith, are not disciplined, and are not in accord with the Dharma.

original: kha cig tshig rtsub mo smra ba can du gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig tshig rtsub mo smra ba can du gyur te /
translated: Some become harsh in speech.

original: tshig gang snyan pa dang / bde ba dang snying du 'ong ba dga' ba pha rol mgu ba /
analyzed: tshig gang snyan pa dang / bde ba dang snying du 'ong ba dga' ba pha rol mgu ba /
translated: They abandon words that are pleasant, agreeable, and endearing, that bring happiness,🔽that are clear,

original: gsal ba / rnam par shes par bya ba /
analyzed: gsal ba / rnam par shes par bya ba /
translated: that are understandable,

original: mnyan par bya ba rjes su mthun pa /🔽skye bo mang po dga' ba /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba rjes su mthun pa / skye bo mang po dga' ba /
translated: that are appropriate,🔽that are loved by many people,

original: skye bo mang po la sdug pa /🔽skye bo mang po rab tu dga' bar byed pa /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la sdug pa / skye bo mang po rab tu dga' bar byed pa /
translated: that are liked by many people,🔽that bring joy to many people,

original: skye bo mang po yid du 'ong ba /🔽mnyam par bzhag pa /
analyzed: skye bo mang po yid du 'ong ba / mnyam par bzhag pa /
translated: that are pleasing to many people,🔽that are conducive to meditative concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin sgrub par byed pa de lta bu'i tshig spangs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sgrub par byed pa de lta bu'i tshig spangs te /
translated: and that are conducive to the attainment of meditative absorption.

original: tshig gang brlang zhing rtsub pa /
analyzed: tshig gang brlang zhing rtsub pa /
translated: They speak words that are harsh,

original: pha rol gyi gnang gcod pa /
analyzed: pha rol gyi gnang gcod pa /
translated: words that cut others,

original: pha rol gyi rjes su mi mthun pa /🔽skye bo mang po mi 'dod pa /
analyzed: pha rol gyi rjes su mi mthun pa / skye bo mang po mi 'dod pa /
translated: words that are not in accord with others,🔽words that are not loved by many people,

original: skye bo mang po la mi sdug pa /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la mi sdug pa /
translated: words that are not liked by many people,

original: skye bo mang po mi dga' zhing //
analyzed: skye bo mang po mi dga' zhing //
translated: He is not liked by many people,

original: skye bo mang po yid du mi 'ong ba /
analyzed: skye bo mang po yid du mi 'ong ba /
translated: and is not pleasing to many people.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa /
translated: He is not in equipoise,

original: ting nge 'dzin ma yin @237b pa sgrub par byed pa de lta bu'i tshig smra zhing tshig rtsub mo las ma log par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ma yin @237b pa sgrub par byed pa de lta bu'i tshig smra zhing tshig rtsub mo las ma log par gyur ba'o //
translated: and is not in samādhi. He speaks such words and does not turn away from harsh speech.

original: kha cig tshig 'khyal pa can du gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig tshig 'khyal pa can du gyur te /
translated: Some become those who speak nonsense,

original: de yang tshig ma yin par smra ba /
analyzed: de yang tshig ma yin par smra ba /
translated: and they speak words that are not words,

original: mi bden par smra ba /🔽de kho na nyid ma yin par smra ba /
analyzed: mi bden par smra ba / de kho na nyid ma yin par smra ba /
translated: speak untruths,🔽speak what is not reality,

original: don ma yin par smra ba /
analyzed: don ma yin par smra ba /
translated: speak what is not the meaning,

original: ma zhi bar smra ba ste 'khrugs shing dus ma yin par smra ba /
analyzed: ma zhi bar smra ba ste 'khrugs shing dus ma yin par smra ba /
translated: speak what is not peace, speak agitatedly and at the wrong time,

original: nye bar brtags pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa ma yin pa /
translated: and do not examine.

original: chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin pa sdud par byed pa /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin pa sdud par byed pa /
translated: They gather what is not Dharma and what is not the meaning,

original: ngag 'khyal pa las ma log par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ngag 'khyal pa las ma log par gyur pa'o //
translated: and do not turn away from idle speech.

original: dge slong dag de ltar na ngag gi sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnam pa bzhi byas shing bsags la nye bar bsags pas rnam par smin pa mi dga' zhing sdug bsngal ba 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na ngag gi sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnam pa bzhi byas shing bsags la nye bar bsags pas rnam par smin pa mi dga' zhing sdug bsngal ba 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Monks, thus, the four types of verbal nonvirtuous karma are created and accumulated. When created and accumulated, they yield an unpleasant and painful ripening.

original: dge slong dag ji ltar na yid kyi las rnam pa gsum byas shing bsags te nye bar bsags pa rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal zhing mi dge ba de gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji ltar na yid kyi las rnam pa gsum byas shing bsags te nye bar bsags pa rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal zhing mi dge ba de gang zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what are the three types of mental nonvirtuous karma that are created and accumulated? What is their unpleasant and painful ripening?

original: kha cig brnab sems can du gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig brnab sems can du gyur te /
translated: Some people are covetous.

original: 'dod pa rnams la yang dag par chags pa drag po ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la yang dag par chags pa drag po ste /
translated: They are strongly attached to desires.

original: gzhan gyi rdzas dang / gzhan gyi nor dang / gzhan gyi nye bar mkho ba rnams la brnab sems skye ba de gzhan gyi de bdag gir gyur kyang ci ma rung zhes brnab sems las ma log par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzas dang / gzhan gyi nor dang / gzhan gyi nye bar mkho ba rnams la brnab sems skye ba de gzhan gyi de bdag gir gyur kyang ci ma rung zhes brnab sems las ma log par gyur pa'o //
translated: They are covetous of others’ wealth, others’ possessions, and others’ necessities, thinking, ‘Oh, if only their wealth, possessions, and necessities were mine!’ They do not turn away from covetousness.

original: kha cig gnod sems can du gyur te gdug pa'i yid kyis rnam par rtog pa 'di snyam du sems can khyed rnams nyams shing pham la don ma yin pa phongs pa thob par gyur cig ces gnod sems las ma log par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig gnod sems can du gyur te gdug pa'i yid kyis rnam par rtog pa 'di snyam du sems can khyed rnams nyams shing pham la don ma yin pa phongs pa thob par gyur cig ces gnod sems las ma log par gyur pa'o //
translated: Some became malicious, and with a malicious mind they thought this thought: “May you sentient beings be defeated and lose, and may you obtain what is not beneficial and is a misfortune!” They did not turn away from malice.

original: kha cig log par lta ba can du gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig log par lta ba can du gyur te /
translated: Some became those who had wrong views.

original: de lta ba phyin ci log pas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: de lta ba phyin ci log pas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: With wrong views, they saw this way and spoke this way:

original: sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa med do //
translated: “There is no giving.

original: mchod sbyin med do //
analyzed: mchod sbyin med do //
translated: There is no offering.

original: legs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa med do //
translated: There is no good conduct.

original: nyes par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa med do //
translated: There is no bad conduct.

original: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: There is no ripening of the fruit of good conduct and bad conduct.

original: 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: There is no this world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
translated: There is no other world.

original: pha med do //
analyzed: pha med do //
translated: There is no father.

original: ma med do //
analyzed: ma med do //
translated: There is no mother.

original: sems can rdzus te byung ba rnams med do //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te byung ba rnams med do //
translated: There are no sentient beings who are spontaneously born.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa yang dag par song zhing yang dag par rtogs pa 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol du mthong ba'i chos nyid la rang nyid kyis mngon par shes la phun sum tshogs pa mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa yang dag par song zhing yang dag par rtogs pa 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol du mthong ba'i chos nyid la rang nyid kyis mngon par shes la phun sum tshogs pa mngon sum du byas te /
translated: In the world, there are Arhats who have gone rightly, who have understood rightly, who in this world and the next have direct knowledge of the attainment of their own knowledge and insight.

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: They have exhausted their defilements.

original: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
translated: They have lived the holy life.

original: bya ba byas so //🔽srid pa 'di las gzhan mi @238a * //
analyzed: bya ba byas so // srid pa 'di las gzhan mi @238a * //
translated: They have done what had to be done.🔽They know that they will not be subject to a later existence.

original: shes so zhes bya ba med do zhes log par lta ba las ma log par gyur pa dag go //🔽dge slong dag 'di ltar yid kyi sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnam pa gsum byas shing bsags la nye bar bsags pas rnam par smin pa mi dga' zhing sdug bsngal ba dag 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes so zhes bya ba med do zhes log par lta ba las ma log par gyur pa dag go // dge slong dag 'di ltar yid kyi sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnam pa gsum byas shing bsags la nye bar bsags pas rnam par smin pa mi dga' zhing sdug bsngal ba dag 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They have no wrong views.🔽Monks, in this way, the three kinds of mental misdeeds are done and accumulated, and their ripening is unpleasant and painful.

original: dge slong dag de la 'phags pa nyan thos lus kyi mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong zhing lus kyi dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par byed do //
analyzed: dge slong dag de la 'phags pa nyan thos lus kyi mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong zhing lus kyi dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par byed do //
translated: Monks, in this way, the noble disciple abandons the unwholesome deeds of the body and cultivates the wholesome deeds of the body.

original: ngag dang yid kyi mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong zhing dag dang yid kyi dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par byed do //
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong zhing dag dang yid kyi dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par byed do //
translated: He abandons unwholesome verbal and mental phenomena and cultivates wholesome verbal and mental phenomena.

original: byams pa dang lhan cig pa'i sems kho na med pa 'gran zla med pa /🔽gnod pa med pa /
analyzed: byams pa dang lhan cig pa'i sems kho na med pa 'gran zla med pa / gnod pa med pa /
translated: With a mind accompanied by loving-kindness, he dwells pervading one direction,🔽vast, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility, without ill will,

original: yangs pa thams cad du song ba tshad med pa legs par bsgoms pas phyogs gcig tu khyab par byas nas yongs su rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: yangs pa thams cad du song ba tshad med pa legs par bsgoms pas phyogs gcig tu khyab par byas nas yongs su rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: having completely transcended all resentment and animosity.🔽In the same way, he dwells pervading the second direction,🔽the third direction, and the fourth direction,🔽the four intermediate directions, above, and below, all around, everywhere.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa dang / de bzhin du bzhi pa dang ; steng dang 'og dang logs kyi 'jig rten 'di thams cad kyi thams cad du byams pa dang lhan cig pa'i sems kho na med cing 'gran zla med pa gnod pa med pa yangs pa thams cad du song ba tshad med pa legs par bsgoms pas khyab par byas
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa dang / de bzhin du bzhi pa dang ; steng dang 'og dang logs kyi 'jig rten 'di thams cad kyi thams cad du byams pa dang lhan cig pa'i sems kho na med cing 'gran zla med pa gnod pa med pa yangs pa thams cad du song ba tshad med pa legs par bsgoms pas khyab par byas
translated: With a mind accompanied by loving-kindness, he dwells pervading the entire world, vast, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility, without ill will,

original: nas yongs su rdzogs par byas nas gnas so //
analyzed: nas yongs su rdzogs par byas nas gnas so //
translated: having completely transcended all resentment and animosity.

original: de 'di snyam du sngon bdag gi sems ma bsgoms shing chung ngur gyur pa de ltar bdag gi tshad med cing legs par bsgom par bya'o snyam pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sngon bdag gi sems ma bsgoms shing chung ngur gyur pa de ltar bdag gi tshad med cing legs par bsgom par bya'o snyam pa'o //
translated: He thinks, “Previously, my mind was not cultivated and was small. Now, I will cultivate it to be immeasurable.”

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa'i sems bag med pa mi srid cing mi ltung la mi gnas shing bgrang bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa'i sems bag med pa mi srid cing mi ltung la mi gnas shing bgrang bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Bhikṣus, for the noble disciple who is learned, it is impossible for the mind to be without mindfulness, to fall, to remain, or to be counted.

original: dge slong dag khye'u dang bu mo byams pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin sgom par byed pa yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i las 'di lta ste lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las byed cing nye bar songs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: dge slong dag khye'u dang bu mo byams pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin sgom par byed pa yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i las 'di lta ste lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las byed cing nye bar songs par 'gyur ram /
translated: Bhikṣus, if a son or daughter of noble family cultivates the samādhi of loving kindness, will they engage in and accumulate evil, unwholesome actions such as actions of body, speech, and mind?

original: gzhan dag las yun ring po don ma yin pa mi phan pa dang sdug bsngal de lta de ltar ston par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gzhan dag las yun ring po don ma yin pa mi phan pa dang sdug bsngal de lta de ltar ston par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or will they teach others for a long time what is not beneficial, what is harmful, and what is suffering?

original: btsun pa ma lags so //🔽dge slong dag legs so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so // dge slong dag legs so //
translated: “No, Venerable One.”

original: legs so // dge slong dag skyes pa'am /
analyzed: legs so // dge slong dag skyes pa'am /
translated: “Bhikṣus, it is excellent, excellent!

original: bud med dam /
analyzed: bud med dam /
translated: Bhikṣus, for a man or woman

original: khyim pa'am / rab tu byung bas kyang byams pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'am / rab tu byung bas kyang byams pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Whether you are a layperson or one gone forth, you should cultivate the meditative absorption of loving kindness.

original: dge slong dag de ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: “Monks, why is that?

original: @238b skyes pa dang bud med dang khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dag kyang lus 'di btang nas pha rol du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: @238b skyes pa dang bud med dang khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dag kyang lus 'di btang nas pha rol du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because men and women, householders and those gone forth, having given up this body, will go on to the next world.

original: dge slong dag sems kyi rjes su 'gro bar sems la brten pa sems kyis bcings pa sams  la brten te 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag sems kyi rjes su 'gro bar sems la brten pa sems kyis bcings pa sams  la brten te 'jug pa'o //
translated: Monks, the mind is what follows the mind, the mind is what supports the mind, the mind is what binds the mind, and the mind is what engages the mind.

original: dge slong dag 'ga' zhig 'di skad du nga'i lus 'di nyid kyis sngon sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas shing bsags la nye bar bsags pa de thams cad 'di la myong bar 'gyur cig skyes nas dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar ma gyur cig ces dge
analyzed: dge slong dag 'ga' zhig 'di skad du nga'i lus 'di nyid kyis sngon sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas shing bsags la nye bar bsags pa de thams cad 'di la myong bar 'gyur cig skyes nas dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar ma gyur cig ces dge
translated: Monks, if someone were to say, ‘I will experience here and now all the evil, unwholesome actions that I have previously committed and accumulated, and I will not experience them after I am born,’

original: slong dag de ltar byams pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan na phyir mi ldog par gnas shing bla na med pa'i chos so sor rig par gyur te /
analyzed: slong dag de ltar byams pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan na phyir mi ldog par gnas shing bla na med pa'i chos so sor rig par gyur te /
translated: If they have the meditative stabilization of the mind of love, then they abide in irreversibility and individually know the unsurpassed Dharma.

original: de la 'phags pa nyan thos pa dang ldan pa lus kyi sdig pa mi dge ba rnams spong zhing lus kyi dge ba'i las rnams sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa nyan thos pa dang ldan pa lus kyi sdig pa mi dge ba rnams spong zhing lus kyi dge ba'i las rnams sgom par byed do //
translated: In this regard, the noble disciples abandon physical nonvirtuous actions and cultivate physical virtuous actions.

original: ngag dang yid kyi sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnams spong zhing ngag dang yid kyi dge ba'i las rnams sgom par byed do //
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnams spong zhing ngag dang yid kyi dge ba'i las rnams sgom par byed do //
translated: They abandon verbal and mental nonvirtuous actions and cultivate verbal and mental virtuous actions.🔽The mind that is accompanied by compassion, joy, and equanimity…

original: de snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms dang lhan cig pa'i sems zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du dge slong dag de ltar btang snyoms kyi sems ting nge 'dzin dang ldan na phyir mi ldog par gnas shing bla na med pa'i chos so sor rig🔽par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: de snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms dang lhan cig pa'i sems zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du dge slong dag de ltar btang snyoms kyi sems ting nge 'dzin dang ldan na phyir mi ldog par gnas shing bla na med pa'i chos so sor rig🔽par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: Bhikṣus, if the mind of equanimity has meditative stabilization, then they abide in irreversibility and individually know the unsurpassed Dharma.

original: dge slong dag srog gcod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong dag srog gcod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Monks, killing is of three types:

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag srog gcod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag srog gcod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Monks, killing is of three types:

original: brnab sems las skyes pa dang / gnod sems las skyes pa dang / gti mug las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems las skyes pa dang / gnod sems las skyes pa dang / gti mug las skyes pa'o //
translated: arisen from covetousness, arisen from malice, and arisen from confusion.

original: dge slong dag ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub mo dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang log par lta ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub mo dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang log par lta ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Monks, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech, malicious speech, harsh speech, frivolous speech, covetousness, malice, and wrong view are of three types:

original: brnab sems las skyes pa dang / gnod sems las skyes pa dang / log par lta ba las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems las skyes pa dang / gnod sems las skyes pa dang / log par lta ba las skyes pa'o //
translated: arisen from covetousness, arisen from malice, and arisen from wrong view.

original: dge slong dag srog gcod pa spang pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag srog gcod pa spang pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Monks, abandoning killing is of three types:

original: ma chags pa las skyes pa dang // zhe sdang med pa las skyes pa dang / gti mug med pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa las skyes pa dang // zhe sdang med pa las skyes pa dang / gti mug med pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: and those that arise from non-greed, non-hatred, and non-delusion.

original: dge slong dag ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem @239a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem @239a * //
translated: Monks, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct,

original: pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub mo dang / tshig 'khyal ba dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / log par lta ba med pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub mo dang / tshig 'khyal ba dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / log par lta ba med pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: false speech, slander, harsh speech, frivolous speech, non-covetousness, non-ill-will, and right view are threefold:

original: ma chags pa las skyes pa dang // zhe sdang med pa las skyes pa dang / gti mug med pa las skyes pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma chags pa las skyes pa dang // zhe sdang med pa las skyes pa dang / gti mug med pa las skyes pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: arising from non-greed, arising from non-hatred, and arising from non-delusion.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: As the Blessed One said:

original: tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis //
analyzed: tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis //
translated: Life, heat, and consciousness

analyzed: btsun pa 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor bsdus shing rnam par ma phye bar bshad pa'i don rgyas par bdag gis 'tshal to //

original: mchod byed kyi ma can legs so legs so //
analyzed: mchod byed kyi ma can legs so legs so //
translated: “Pūjās, it is excellent, it is excellent!

original: mchod byed kyi @242b ma can khyod kyis ngas mdor bsdus te rnam par ma phye bar bshad pa'i don khyod kyis shes pa legs so //
analyzed: mchod byed kyi @242b ma can khyod kyis ngas mdor bsdus te rnam par ma phye bar bshad pa'i don khyod kyis shes pa legs so //
translated: Pūjās, it is excellent that you have understood the meaning of what I have taught in brief without expounding it in detail.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs rnams mthong na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs rnams mthong na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: When one sees forms…

original: de bzhin dran dang ldan par spyod //
analyzed: de bzhin dran dang ldan par spyod //
translated: Thus, one should practice with mindfulness.”

original: ces bya ba'i bar du tshigs su bcad pa rgyas par ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i bar du tshigs su bcad pa rgyas par ro //
translated: Thus it is stated in detail up to this verse.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mchod byed kyi ma can zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mchod byed kyi ma can zhes bya ba nas /
