analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: departed from the presence of the Blessed One.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mchod byed kyi ma can bcom ldan 'das las mdor bsdus pa'i gdams ngag thos nas dgra bcom pa sems rnam par grol ba'i bar du gyur to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mchod byed kyi ma can bcom ldan 'das las mdor bsdus pa'i gdams ngag thos nas dgra bcom pa sems rnam par grol ba'i bar du gyur to zhes gsungs so //
translated: Then the venerable Upali heard the concise instruction from the Bhagavan and became an arhat with liberated mind.🔽As it says in a sutra:

original: mdo las ji skad du 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the power of desire for sense objects,

original: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi phung po dbyu gu gsum pa'i mdo de dang de las 'don pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi phung po dbyu gu gsum pa'i mdo de dang de las 'don pa lta bu ste /
translated: as it is recited in this and that sutra of the three baskets of ethics,

original: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dang yang dag par ldan zhing 'dis dbang po'i sgo bsdams shing yang dag pa'i dran pa dang shes bzhin 'di dag dang ldan zhing rnam par dben pa'i mal cha dang stan la brten te dgon pa dang shing drung dang khang
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dang yang dag par ldan zhing 'dis dbang po'i sgo bsdams shing yang dag pa'i dran pa dang shes bzhin 'di dag dang ldan zhing rnam par dben pa'i mal cha dang stan la brten te dgon pa dang shing drung dang khang
translated: he is endowed with the noble aggregate of ethics and with the restraint of the sense faculties, endowed with this right mindfulness and vigilance, he resorts to solitary bedding and seats in the forest, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty place.🔽He goes to the forest,🔽to the foot of a tree,

original: pa stong par gnas pa'am /🔽de dgon pa'am /🔽shing drung ngam /🔽khang pa stong par song ste /
analyzed: pa stong par gnas pa'am /🔽de dgon pa'am /🔽shing drung ngam /🔽khang pa stong par song ste /
translated: or to an empty place,

original: skyil mo krung bcas shing lus drang po re bsrang ste /
analyzed: skyil mo krung bcas shing lus drang po re bsrang ste /
translated: Sit cross-legged with your body straight.🔽

original: dran pa mngon du phyags par bzhag nas 'dug ste /
analyzed: dran pa mngon du phyags par bzhag nas 'dug ste /
translated: He sits with his legs crossed, his body erect, and his mindfulness well present.🔽He abandons worldly covetousness and abides with a mind free of covetousness.

original: sems la 'jig rten gyi brnab sems spangs te brnab sems dang bral bar lan mang du gnas shing sems la brnab sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: sems la 'jig rten gyi brnab sems spangs te brnab sems dang bral bar lan mang du gnas shing sems la brnab sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
translated: He abandons worldly ill will and abides with a mind free of ill will.🔽He abandons worldly sloth and torpor and abides without sloth and torpor.🔽He abandons worldly excitement and contrition and abides without excitement.

original: gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyis dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang // 'jig rten gyi the tshom spangs shing som nyi las brgal cing the tshom las brgal te /🔽dge ba'i chos rnams la the tshom med cing the tshom las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyis dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang // 'jig rten gyi the tshom spangs shing som nyi las brgal cing the tshom las brgal te /🔽dge ba'i chos rnams la the tshom med cing the tshom las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
translated: He abandons worldly doubt and abides having crossed over and gone beyond doubt.🔽He abandons worldly views and abides having crossed over and gone beyond views.

original: de sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa gegs kyi phyogs mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa'i sgrib pa lnga po spangs nas 'dod pa las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben
analyzed: de sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa gegs kyi phyogs mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa'i sgrib pa lnga po spangs nas 'dod pa las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben
translated: Having abandoned the five obscurations that are mental afflictions, that weaken wisdom, that are on the side of the hindrances, and that are established as not being nirvana, he abides in the fourth concentration, having achieved and remained in the first concentration, which is free from desires and free from negative and nonvirtuous attributes,

original: pa zhes bya ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //🔽med par lta bas rtsa ba gcod //
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o // med par lta bas rtsa ba gcod //
translated: and so on up to having achieved and remained in the fourth concentration.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The root is severed by the view of nonexistence.

original: gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba @243a * //
analyzed: gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba @243a * //
translated: By what is the root of virtue severed?

original: kun du gcod cing ji ltar kun du gcod la rnam pa gang gis kun du gcod ce na /
analyzed: kun du gcod cing ji ltar kun du gcod la rnam pa gang gis kun du gcod ce na /
translated: How is it severed? By what mode is it severed?

original: smras pa / gang zag kha cig gis pha dang ma bsams bzhin du srog dang phral nas 'gyod pa dang lhan cig pa'i sems cha tsam yang mi bskyed la kha cig gis pha dang ma bsams bzhin du srog dang phral bar byas nas 'gyod pa cha shas tsam skyed par byed
analyzed: smras pa / gang zag kha cig gis pha dang ma bsams bzhin du srog dang phral nas 'gyod pa dang lhan cig pa'i sems cha tsam yang mi bskyed la kha cig gis pha dang ma bsams bzhin du srog dang phral bar byas nas 'gyod pa cha shas tsam skyed par byed
translated: Some people kill their parents intentionally and generate a small amount of regret.

original: do // de na dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: do // de na dge sbyong ngam /
translated: There are no ascetics or brahmins

original: 'jig rten rgyang ban pa'i rigs can med do zhes smra ba rgyu med par smra ba de dag dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams zhig cing chad nas med pa yin no zhes 'dogs te de de dang de'i drung du nye bar song nas dri ba 'di
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang ban pa'i rigs can med do zhes smra ba rgyu med par smra ba de dag dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams zhig cing chad nas med pa yin no zhes 'dogs te de de dang de'i drung du nye bar song nas dri ba 'di
translated: who say, ‘Those who say, “There is no cause or condition for the destruction of wholesome and unwholesome actions,” are without wholesome and unwholesome actions, and their wholesome and unwholesome actions are destroyed and annihilated,” and so on.🔽When they approach someone who holds that view, they ask this question:

original: 'dri ste / dge ba ni gang zhig yin /🔽kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'dri ste / dge ba ni gang zhig yin / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: “What is wholesome?🔽What is reprehensible?

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: What is irreproachable?

original: ci zhig byas na dge bar 'gyur zhing sdig par mi 'gyur zhes dris pa dang / des de 'gyod pa ma skyes pa mi skyed cing 'gyod pa skyes pa dag kyang nga myur du sel bar byed de /
analyzed: ci zhig byas na dge bar 'gyur zhing sdig par mi 'gyur zhes dris pa dang / des de 'gyod pa ma skyes pa mi skyed cing 'gyod pa skyes pa dag kyang nga myur du sel bar byed de /
translated: “He does not cause regret in those who have not generated regret, and he quickly dispels the regret of those who have generated regret.

original: 'di skad du srog gcod pa ni 'bras bu dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du srog gcod pa ni 'bras bu dang bral ba ste /
translated: He says, ‘Killing has no result.

original: 'bras bu med pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa /
translated: It is fruitless.

original: don med pa /
analyzed: don med pa /
translated: It is meaningless.

original: skye ba med pa /🔽ro med pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa / ro med pa /
translated: It is unborn.🔽It is flavorless.

original: bsngags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bsngags pa med pa ste /
translated: It is unpraised.

original: srog gcod pa la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med do //
translated: There is no ripened result of killing.

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub mo dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ni 'bras bu dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub mo dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ni 'bras bu dang bral ba ste /
translated: Taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, covetousness, malice, and wrong view have no result.

original: 'bras bu med pa don med pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa don med pa /
translated: They are fruitless, meaningless,

original: skye ba med pa ro med bsngags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa ro med bsngags pa med pa ste /
translated: unborn, flavorless, and unpraised.

original: log par lta ba med cing log par lta ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes brjod la /
analyzed: log par lta ba med cing log par lta ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes brjod la /
translated: There is no wrong view and no ripening of the fruit of wrong view.

analyzed: de de la 'dod cing bzod la yang dag par gsal bar byed do //
translated: He desires this, accepts it, and makes it clear.

original: gang gi tshe de 'dod cing bzod la gsal bar byed pa 'di tsam gyis na gang zag g-yon gyi lam du zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de 'dod cing bzod la gsal bar byed pa 'di tsam gyis na gang zag g-yon gyi lam du zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When he desires this, accepts it, and makes it clear, then to that extent he is called a person who has entered the path of the left.

original: 'di lta ste log par lta ba can /
analyzed: 'di lta ste log par lta ba can /
translated: He is called one who has wrong view,

original: log par rtog pa dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / log pa'i 'tsho ba log pa'i ting nge 'dzin can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: log par rtog pa dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / log pa'i 'tsho ba log pa'i ting nge 'dzin can zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de 'di lta bu'i g-yon pa'i lam la zhugs pas nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum 'phel zhing drag por 'gyur zhing mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he has entered this path of the left, the three kinds of bad conduct increase, become stronger, and become more numerous.

original: @243b legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum 'bri zhing srab mor 'gyur zhing yang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @243b legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum 'bri zhing srab mor 'gyur zhing yang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The three kinds of good conduct decrease, become weaker, and become less.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa gsum 'phel zhing drag por 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa gsum 'phel zhing drag por 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: The three roots of non-virtue increase and become strong, and there is much suffering.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa gsum 'bri zhing srab mor 'gyur zhing yang bar 'gyur la gseng chags can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa gsum 'bri zhing srab mor 'gyur zhing yang bar 'gyur la gseng chags can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The three roots of virtue decrease and become weak, and are lost.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu mngon par 'phel zhing drag por 'gyur zhing stug la mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu mngon par 'phel zhing drag por 'gyur zhing stug la mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: The ten paths of non-virtuous action increase and become strong, and become thick and numerous.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam phra zhing srab mor 'gyur zhing gseng tshags can du 'gyur te /🔽g-yon phyogs kyi lam 'phel zhing drag por 'gyur zhing stug la mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam phra zhing srab mor 'gyur zhing gseng tshags can du 'gyur te / g-yon phyogs kyi lam 'phel zhing drag por 'gyur zhing stug la mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: The ten paths of virtuous action become thin and weak, and are lost.🔽The left-hand path increases and becomes strong, and becomes thick and numerous.

original: g-yas phyogs kyi lam 'bri zhing srab mor 'gyur la yang zhing gseng tshags can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yas phyogs kyi lam 'bri zhing srab mor 'gyur la yang zhing gseng tshags can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The right-hand path decreases and becomes weak, and is lost.

original: de mang du srog gcod pa can du 'gyur zhing ma byin par len pa 'dod pas log par g-yem pa /🔽brdzun du smra ba /
analyzed: de mang du srog gcod pa can du 'gyur zhing ma byin par len pa 'dod pas log par g-yem pa / brdzun du smra ba /
translated: They become killers, and desire to take what is not given, and to engage in sexual misconduct.🔽They lie.

original: phra ma smra ba /
analyzed: phra ma smra ba /
translated: They slander.

original: tshig rtsub mo smra ba ;
analyzed: tshig rtsub mo smra ba ;
translated: harsh words,

original: tshig kyal pa smra ba /
analyzed: tshig kyal pa smra ba /
translated: frivolous speech,

original: brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba can du 'gyur te /
translated: covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: de 'di lta bu'i ma dul bas mang du gnas par 'gyur zhing ma bsdams pas mang du gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'di lta bu'i ma dul bas mang du gnas par 'gyur zhing ma bsdams pas mang du gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, he will be undisciplined and unrestrained.

original: res 'ga' zhig ci zhig ltar dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig ci zhig ltar dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes, for some reason, virtuous thoughts and mental states will manifest.

original: de nas yang mi dge ba nyid mang du kun du spyod de gang yang phal cher g-yon phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang mi dge ba nyid mang du kun du spyod de gang yang phal cher g-yon phyogs pa ste /
translated: Then, he will again engage in many nonvirtuous actions, and he will mostly be on the wrong path.

original: dbyar phyi ma ston gyi dus la bab pa na glog chen po byung bas snang ba dang cung zad snang ba dang / gzugs mthong bar byas nas myur du nub pa de bzhin du de 'di lta bu'i ma dul ba dang ma bsdams pa lan mang du gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyar phyi ma ston gyi dus la bab pa na glog chen po byung bas snang ba dang cung zad snang ba dang / gzugs mthong bar byas nas myur du nub pa de bzhin du de 'di lta bu'i ma dul ba dang ma bsdams pa lan mang du gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as when the last summer month has passed and autumn arrives, a great flash of lightning illuminates the sky, and then quickly disappears, in the same way, he will be undisciplined and unrestrained.

original: brgya la res 'ga' zhig na dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mngon du 'gyur zhing de nas yang mi dge ba nyid du sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brgya la res 'ga' zhig na dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mngon du 'gyur zhing de nas yang mi dge ba nyid du sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Sometimes, on rare occasions, virtuous minds and mental factors manifest, but then he is immediately drawn back into nonvirtue.

original: gang yang phal cher g-yon phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang phal cher g-yon phyogs pa ste /
translated: He is mostly on the wrong path.🔽For example, when a person is tormented by heat, exhausted by thirst and heat, and enters a cool pond, he quickly emerges from it.

original: 'di lta ste tsha bas gdung sa shing tsha bas nyen ba'i skyes bu skom zhing ngal la tshad bas nyen pa dag khron pa bsil mo'i nang du zhugs te myur du de nas byung na de'i chu dang chu'i thigs pa rags pa dag myur ba myur bar rgal
analyzed: 'di lta ste tsha bas gdung sa shing tsha bas nyen ba'i skyes bu skom zhing ngal la tshad bas nyen pa dag khron pa bsil mo'i nang du zhugs te myur du de nas byung na de'i chu dang chu'i thigs pa rags pa dag myur ba myur bar rgal
translated: The coarse water and water drops quickly pass through him.

original: la ltung bar 'gyur zhing 'di ltar ba sbu'i bu ga na chu phra mo dag yod pa de bzhin du ma dul zhing @244a * //
analyzed: la ltung bar 'gyur zhing 'di ltar ba sbu'i bu ga na chu phra mo dag yod pa de bzhin du ma dul zhing @244a * //
translated: In the same way, the subtle water in the pores of the skin of an undisciplined and unrestrained person is quickly lost.

original: ma bsdams pa lan mang du gnas pa 'di'i brgya la res 'ga' zhing dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bsdams pa lan mang du gnas pa 'di'i brgya la res 'ga' zhing dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes, on rare occasions, virtuous minds and mental factors manifest.

original: de nas yang mi dge ba nyid mang du kun du spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas yang mi dge ba nyid mang du kun du spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, he will frequently engage in nonvirtuous actions.

original: gang yang phal cher g-yon phyogs par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: gang yang phal cher g-yon phyogs par 'gyur ro//
translated: He will be mostly on the left-hand path.

original: de srog chags khyad par can bsams bzhin du srog dang phral ba la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa med do zhes dus gzhan du yang de 'gyod pa'i sems cha tsam yang de 'gyod pa'i sems cha tsam yang skyed par mi byed
analyzed: de srog chags khyad par can bsams bzhin du srog dang phral ba la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa med do zhes dus gzhan du yang de 'gyod pa'i sems cha tsam yang de 'gyod pa'i sems cha tsam yang skyed par mi byed
translated: He will not even have a trace of regret when he kills a living being, thinking, “There is no ripening of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.”

original: de / gang yang gang zag khyad par can srog dang phral ba la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa med do zhes 'gyod pa'i sems cung zad tsam yang skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: de / gang yang gang zag khyad par can srog dang phral ba la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa med do zhes 'gyod pa'i sems cung zad tsam yang skyed par mi byed de /
translated: He will not even have a trace of regret when he kills a living being, thinking, “There is no ripening of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.”

original: 'di tsam gyis na gang zag 'di'i khams gsum pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis na gang zag 'di'i khams gsum pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: To this extent, it should be said that this person has severed the wholesome roots that are associated with the three realms.

original: gang zag 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mthong ba'i chos nyid la nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skal ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mthong ba'i chos nyid la nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skal ba med pa ste /
translated: The wholesome roots of this person are not fit to be connected with the present life.

original: gang zag 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dmyal ba dag nas 'chi 'pho ba'am skye ba na nges par nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dmyal ba dag nas 'chi 'pho ba'am skye ba na nges par nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The wholesome roots of this person will definitely be connected with the present life when he dies and transmigrates from the hells or is reborn there.

original: gang yang 'di lta bu gang zag bsams bzhin du srog dang phral ba dang / gang yang srog chags grog sbur dag srog dang phral na gang zhig kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang 'di lta bu gang zag bsams bzhin du srog dang phral ba dang / gang yang srog chags grog sbur dag srog dang phral na gang zhig kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If someone were to kill intentionally a person like this and also kill an ant, which would be the greater offense?

original: kun nas dkris pa mnyam na rnam par smin pa mnyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa mnyam na rnam par smin pa mnyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the entanglements are equal, the karmic maturation will be equal.

original: 'di skad du zer ba yang yod de /
analyzed: 'di skad du zer ba yang yod de /
translated: There are some who say:

original: srog chags grog sbur dag bsams bzhin du srog dang phral na kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: srog chags grog sbur dag bsams bzhin du srog dang phral na kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one intentionally kills an ant, it is a greater offense

original: gang zag 'di lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zag 'di lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: than killing a person like this.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa srog chags grog sbur dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad la gang zag 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i phyir ro zhes phra rgyas btags pa'i dbugs 'byung ba brgyad pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs kyi phung po lnga pa las 'don to //🔽tshul khrims kyi phung po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: smras pa srog chags grog sbur dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad la gang zag 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i phyir ro zhes phra rgyas btags pa'i dbugs 'byung ba brgyad pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs kyi phung po lnga pa las 'don to // tshul khrims kyi phung po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The eighth wind that is designated as the negative tendency and the five aggregates of consciousness are recited in the sutra.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po'i dbyu gu gsum pa'i mdo las 'di ltar 'don te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po'i dbyu gu gsum pa'i mdo las 'di ltar 'don te /
translated: The three-sectioned morality aggregate sutra states:

original: ji ltar yang dbyu gu gsum pha dge sbyong ngam bram ze dad pas byin pa longs spod cing rnam pa du ma lta bu'i phyir rjes su sbyor bas mngon par brtson pas gnas te /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dbyu gu gsum pha dge sbyong ngam bram ze dad pas byin pa longs spod cing rnam pa du ma lta bu'i phyir rjes su sbyor bas mngon par brtson pas gnas te /
translated: Just as a three-sectioned stick is used to stir the fire of a brahman or a faithful person who enjoys the offerings, so too, one should abide in equipoise by applying oneself to the many aspects of the path.

original: @244b 'di lta ste glang po che 'thab pa dang / rta 'thab pa dang / shing rta 'thab pa dang / rkang thang 'thab pa dang / rdo bas 'thab pa dang / khu tshur 'thab pa dang / khyu mchog 'thab pa dang / ba lang 'thab pa dang /🔽ra 'thab pa dang / lug 'thab pa dang / khyim bya 'thab pa dang / chu skyar 'thab pa dang / khyim bya dang chu skyar 'thab pa dang / skyes bu 'thab pa dang / bud med 'thab pa dang / gzhon nu 'thab pa dang /
analyzed: @244b 'di lta ste glang po che 'thab pa dang / rta 'thab pa dang / shing rta 'thab pa dang / rkang thang 'thab pa dang / rdo bas 'thab pa dang / khu tshur 'thab pa dang / khyu mchog 'thab pa dang / ba lang 'thab pa dang / ra 'thab pa dang / lug 'thab pa dang / khyim bya 'thab pa dang / chu skyar 'thab pa dang / khyim bya dang chu skyar 'thab pa dang / skyes bu 'thab pa dang / bud med 'thab pa dang / gzhon nu 'thab pa dang /
translated: They are elephant fights, horse fights, chariot fights, infantry fights, stone fights, fist fights, bull fights, cow fights,

original: gzhon nu ma 'thab pa dang / khang pa dang / khang bzangs dang / rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang dpung gi mchog bshams pa la lta ba nyams su myong bar byed /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma 'thab pa dang / khang pa dang / khang bzangs dang / rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang dpung gi mchog bshams pa la lta ba nyams su myong bar byed /
translated: goat fights, sheep fights, cock fights, heron fights, fights between men and women, fights between boys and girls, and fights between houses, palaces, flags, and armies.🔽They experience the pleasure of watching these things.

original: dge sbyong ngam bram ze de dag rnam pa 'di lta bu'i lta ba la brtson pa'i sbyor bas sbyor zhing gnas pa dang bral bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //🔽gang yang gnas brtan ma 'gags pas ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽rgyal po dang yang dag par ldan pa las /🔽'khor lo gnyis dang / mtshan gnyis dang // chu ral lha yi pho nya dang // aa tag bi dhem gi dang ni //
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam bram ze de dag rnam pa 'di lta bu'i lta ba la brtson pa'i sbyor bas sbyor zhing gnas pa dang bral bar bya'o zhes gsungs so // gang yang gnas brtan ma 'gags pas ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / rgyal po dang yang dag par ldan pa las / 'khor lo gnyis dang / mtshan gnyis dang // chu ral lha yi pho nya dang // aa tag bi dhem gi dang ni //
translated: The elder Kapphina said, Those ascetics and brahmins who are attached to the view of neither existence nor non-existence should be liberated from such a view.

original: dngos dang phyis kyi mdo dag go //
analyzed: dngos dang phyis kyi mdo dag go //
translated: The elder Vāgīśa said, Those ascetics and brahmins who are attached to the view of existence and non-existence should be liberated from such a view.🔽 The elder Aniruddha said, Those ascetics and brahmins who are attached to the view of neither existence nor non-existence should be liberated from such a view.🔽 The elder Śāriputra said, Those ascetics and brahmins who are attached to the view of existence and non-existence should be liberated from such a view.

original: zhes bya ba'i mdo tha ma las //🔽bcom ldan 'das b'a r'a na s'i na drang srong smra bar ri dags kyi nags na bzhugs te /🔽de nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag nye bar gnas pa'i phyir 'dus shing tshogs par gyur te 'dun pa dag bar skabs su 'di lta bu'i gtam brjod ba byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mdo tha ma las //🔽bcom ldan 'das b'a r'a na s'i na drang srong smra bar ri dags kyi nags na bzhugs te /🔽de nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag nye bar gnas pa'i phyir 'dus shing tshogs par gyur te 'dun pa dag bar skabs su 'di lta bu'i gtam brjod ba byung ste /
translated: The elder Mahāmaudgalyāyana said

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyim pa gos dkar po can gang gi khyim du nyi ma re re zhing k'a rsh'a pa na brgya rnyed pa dang / gang gis dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can ltung ba dang bral bal bsod snyoms gcig yongs su longs spyod par phul na gang zhig gis yin //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyim pa gos dkar po can gang gi khyim du nyi ma re re zhing k'a rsh'a pa na brgya rnyed pa dang / gang gis dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can ltung ba dang bral bal bsod snyoms gcig yongs su longs spyod par phul na gang zhig gis yin //
translated: and suppose someone offered a single meal to a fully ordained monk who possesses ethical conduct, has virtuous qualities, and is free from downfalls. Which would be greater?

original: de na gcig gis smras na /
analyzed: de na gcig gis smras na /
translated: One of them said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyim pa gos dkar po can gang gi khyim du nyi ma re re zhing k'a rsh'a pa ni rgya rnyed pa bas dang gis dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can ltung ba dang bral ba la bsod snyoms gcig yongs
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyim pa gos dkar po can gang gi khyim du nyi ma re re zhing k'a rsh'a pa ni rgya rnyed pa bas dang gis dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can ltung ba dang bral ba la bsod snyoms gcig yongs
translated: “Venerable ones, suppose there were a householder in white clothes whose house every day received a hundred kārṣāpaṇas, and suppose someone offered a single meal to a fully ordained monk who possesses ethical conduct, has virtuous qualities, and is free from downfalls.

original: su longs spyod par phul na mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: su longs spyod par phul na mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The latter would be greater.”

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: Another said,🔽“Venerable ones, suppose there were a householder in white clothes whose house every day received a hundred kārṣāpaṇas, and suppose someone offered a single meal to a fully ordained monk who possesses ethical conduct, has virtuous qualities, and is free from downfalls.🔽The latter would be greater.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyim pa gos dkar po can gang gi khyim du nyi ma re re zhing k'a rsh'a pa na brgya rnyed pa pas k'a rsh'a pa na stong rnyed kyang ci zhig bya /🔽gang gis dge slong tshul @245a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyim pa gos dkar po can gang gi khyim du nyi ma re re zhing k'a rsh'a pa na brgya rnyed pa pas k'a rsh'a pa na stong rnyed kyang ci zhig bya / gang gis dge slong tshul @245a * //
translated: Venerable ones, what is the use of a householder in white clothes who every day obtains a hundred kārṣāpaṇas, or even a thousand kārṣāpaṇas?

original: khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can ltung ba dang bral ba la bsod snyoms gcig yongs su longs spyod par phul na mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can ltung ba dang bral ba la bsod snyoms gcig yongs su longs spyod par phul na mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: But if someone were to offer a single alms-meal to a monk who is endowed with morality, who possesses virtuous qualities, and who is free from downfalls, that would be supreme.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa 'khor 'dus pa de'i nang du 'dus shing 'tshogs par gyur pa 'dug ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa 'khor 'dus pa de'i nang du 'dus shing 'tshogs par gyur pa 'dug ste /
translated: At that time, the Venerable Aniruddha was present in the assembly of monks who had gathered together.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas dge slong rnams la bos te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas dge slong rnams la bos te /
translated: Then the Venerable Aniruddha addressed the monks:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyim pa gos dkar po can gang gi khyim du nyi ma re re zhing k'arsha pa na brgya dang stong dang stong phrag brgya rnyed kyang ci zhig bya /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyim pa gos dkar po can gang gi khyim du nyi ma re re zhing k'arsha pa na brgya dang stong dang stong phrag brgya rnyed kyang ci zhig bya /
translated: Venerable ones, what is the use of a householder in white clothes who every day obtains a hundred, a thousand, or even a hundred thousand kārṣāpaṇas?

original: gang gis dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can ltung ba dang / bral ba la bsod snyoms gcig yongs spyad bar phul na ches mchog tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can ltung ba dang / bral ba la bsod snyoms gcig yongs spyad bar phul na ches mchog tu 'gyur te /
translated: If one were to offer a single alms-meal to a monk who is endowed with morality, who has virtuous qualities, and who is free from downfalls, that would be far superior.

original: tshe dang ldan dag b'a r'a na s'i 'di nyid du skyes bu dbul po rtsa thu ba zhig tu gyur pa mngon par dran te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan dag b'a r'a na s'i 'di nyid du skyes bu dbul po rtsa thu ba zhig tu gyur pa mngon par dran te /
translated: “Venerable ones, I recall that in this very Vārāṇasī I was born as a poor man, a beggar.

original: de nang par langs te zer ba thogs nas rtva thu ba'i phyir p'a r'a na s'i nas 'gro ste /
analyzed: de nang par langs te zer ba thogs nas rtva thu ba'i phyir p'a r'a na s'i nas 'gro ste /
translated: Rising in the morning, taking my bowl, I went to Vārāṇasī to collect alms.

original: de'i tshe na rang sangs rgyas steng gnas zhes bya ba zhig b'a r'a na s'i na nye bar brten cing bzhugs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na rang sangs rgyas steng gnas zhes bya ba zhig b'a r'a na s'i na nye bar brten cing bzhugs so //
translated: At that time, a solitary buddha named Uparittha was living in support of Vārāṇasī.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te bsod snyoms kyi phyir b'a r'a na s'ir zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te bsod snyoms kyi phyir b'a r'a na s'ir zhugs so //
translated: Then, in the morning, the Blessed One put on his lower robe and upper robe, took his alms bowl, and entered Vārāṇasī for alms.

original: bcom ldan 'das de zhugs pa bdag 'gro bas mthong zhing bdag 'gro ba dang yang bcom ldan 'das de zhugs pas mthong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de zhugs pa bdag 'gro bas mthong zhing bdag 'gro ba dang yang bcom ldan 'das de zhugs pas mthong ngo //
translated: As I was going, I saw the Blessed One entering, and as the Blessed One was entering, I saw him.

original: de nas nga myur bar rtsva khur bu gang khyer nas b'a r'a na s'ir zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas nga myur bar rtsva khur bu gang khyer nas b'a r'a na s'ir zhugs so //
translated: Then I quickly took a bundle of grass and entered Vārāṇasī.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ji ltar b'a r'a na s'ir lhung bzed bkrus te bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa de bzhin du phyir byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ji ltar b'a r'a na s'ir lhung bzed bkrus te bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa de bzhin du phyir byung bar gyur te /
translated: Just as the Blessed One entered Vārāṇasī to beg for alms after washing his alms bowl, he came out in the same way.

original: bsod snyoms gcig kyang ma brnyes so //🔽bcom ldan 'das de byung nas gshegs pas bdag zhugs pa mthong nas 'di snyam du skyes bu 'di 'gro ba yang bdag zhugs pas mthong zhing da ltar skyes bu zhugs pa yang dag 'gro bas mthong ba las na skyes bu 'dis nges par zas kyi bya ba ma
analyzed: bsod snyoms gcig kyang ma brnyes so // bcom ldan 'das de byung nas gshegs pas bdag zhugs pa mthong nas 'di snyam du skyes bu 'di 'gro ba yang bdag zhugs pas mthong zhing da ltar skyes bu zhugs pa yang dag 'gro bas mthong ba las na skyes bu 'dis nges par zas kyi bya ba ma
translated: He did not obtain even a single alms.

original: byas so zhes dgongs nas da'i phyi bzhin phyi bzhin du 'brangs so //
analyzed: byas so zhes dgongs nas da'i phyi bzhin phyi bzhin du 'brangs so //
translated: When the Blessed One came out and left, I saw him. Thinking, This person was seen by me when he entered, and now this person who entered is seen by me when he leaves. Therefore, this person has certainly not done the act of eating, I followed after him.

original: de nas bdag rang gi khang par phyin nas rtsva'i khur bu phyogs gcig tu bzhag nas rgyab tu bltas pa dang / bcom ldan 'das de sgo'i drung na bzhugs pa mthong ngo //🔽mthong nas bdag 'di snyam du bcom ldan 'das 'di bdag 'gro bas mthong zhing bdag @245b 'gro ba yang bcom ldan 'das 'di zhugs pas mthong /
analyzed: de nas bdag rang gi khang par phyin nas rtsva'i khur bu phyogs gcig tu bzhag nas rgyab tu bltas pa dang / bcom ldan 'das de sgo'i drung na bzhugs pa mthong ngo // mthong nas bdag 'di snyam du bcom ldan 'das 'di bdag 'gro bas mthong zhing bdag @245b 'gro ba yang bcom ldan 'das 'di zhugs pas mthong /
translated: I went to my house, put the bundle of grass to one side, and looked back. I saw the Blessed One standing at the door.🔽When I saw him, I thought, “The Blessed One saw me leaving, and I saw the Blessed One enter.

original: bdag zhugs pa yang 'di 'gro bas mthong la /
analyzed: bdag zhugs pa yang 'di 'gro bas mthong la /
translated: I saw the Blessed One enter, and he saw me leaving.

original: 'di 'gro bas kyang bdag zhugs pa mthong la da ltar 'di sgo drung na bzhugs pa mthong ba las na 'phags pa 'dis nges par zas kyi bya ba ma byas kyis gang bdag gi phyir bzhag pa'i zas de dag bcom ldan 'das 'di la bsod snyoms 'bul bar
analyzed: 'di 'gro bas kyang bdag zhugs pa mthong la da ltar 'di sgo drung na bzhugs pa mthong ba las na 'phags pa 'dis nges par zas kyi bya ba ma byas kyis gang bdag gi phyir bzhag pa'i zas de dag bcom ldan 'das 'di la bsod snyoms 'bul bar
translated: Now I see him standing at the door. Since the noble one has not yet done his alms round, I will offer the food I set aside for myself to the Blessed One as alms.

original: bya'o snyam nas de nas bdag gis myur ba myur bar bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan bshams te /
analyzed: bya'o snyam nas de nas bdag gis myur ba myur bar bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan bshams te /
translated: ” I quickly prepared a seat for the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzhugs su gsol zhes smras nas bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzhugs pa dang / de nas ngas bdag gi phyir bzhag pa'i zas dag bcom ldan 'das de la bsod snyoms phul ba dang bcom ldan 'das des bdag la 'di skad ces kye skyes bu de las phyed bdag la bsod snyoms phul la phyed khyod bza' bar gyis shig dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzhugs su gsol zhes smras nas bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzhugs pa dang / de nas ngas bdag gi phyir bzhag pa'i zas dag bcom ldan 'das de la bsod snyoms phul ba dang bcom ldan 'das des bdag la 'di skad ces kye skyes bu de las phyed bdag la bsod snyoms phul la phyed khyod bza' bar gyis shig dang /
translated: I said to him, ‘Blessed One, please sit on the seat that has been prepared.’ The Blessed One sat on the seat that had been prepared, and I offered him the almsfood that I had set aside for myself. The Blessed One said to me, ‘O man, offer half of the almsfood to me and eat half yourself.

original: 'o skol gnyis ka'i bkres pa zlog par 'gyur ro zhes smras so //🔽bdag gis 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: 'o skol gnyis ka'i bkres pa zlog par 'gyur ro zhes smras so // bdag gis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: In that way, both of us will be able to overcome our hunger.’

original: bdag cag ni khyim na gnas shing gzhi bdag ste /
analyzed: bdag cag ni khyim na gnas shing gzhi bdag ste /
translated: I said to him, ‘Blessed One, I am a householder, a landowner.

original: bdag cag la til dang 'bras dang myong gu yod la ma sha yang yod cing /
analyzed: bdag cag la til dang 'bras dang myong gu yod la ma sha yang yod cing /
translated: I have sesame seeds, rice, and mung beans, and I have a wife.

original: btsun pa bdag cag ni dus dang dus ma yin par yang za ba lags kyis bcom ldan 'das ni dus su gsol zhing dus su bzhed la dus srung ba lags kyis bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse bar dgongs la bdag las bsod snyoms 'di bzhes su gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag cag ni dus dang dus ma yin par yang za ba lags kyis bcom ldan 'das ni dus su gsol zhing dus su bzhed la dus srung ba lags kyis bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse bar dgongs la bdag las bsod snyoms 'di bzhes su gsol /
translated: “Lord, we eat at the right time and the wrong time, but the Blessed One eats at the right time, desires the right time, and observes the right time. Blessed One, please consider me with compassion and accept this alms from me.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das des thugs brtse bas bdag las bsod snyoms de bzhes so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das des thugs brtse bas bdag las bsod snyoms de bzhes so //
translated: Then, out of compassion, the Blessed One accepted the alms from him.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bsod snyoms bzhes te lhung bzed thogs nas de bzhin du nam mkha' la gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bsod snyoms bzhes te lhung bzed thogs nas de bzhin du nam mkha' la gshegs so //
translated: Then, after the Blessed One had accepted the alms, he took his alms bowl and flew up into the sky.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ngas mngon par shes te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ngas mngon par shes te /
translated: “Venerable ones, I have knowledge of this.

original: bdag ni bsod snyoms gcig po de'i rnam par smin pas lan bdun gyi bar du sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha bzang po'i rigs su skyes shing lan bdun gyi bar du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po mtha' bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba chos can chos kyi rgyal
analyzed: bdag ni bsod snyoms gcig po de'i rnam par smin pas lan bdun gyi bar du sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha bzang po'i rigs su skyes shing lan bdun gyi bar du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po mtha' bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba chos can chos kyi rgyal
translated: Because of the ripening of that single alms offering, I was born seven times among the excellent families of the Thirty-Three Gods, and seven times I was a wheel-turning king who had conquered the border regions in the four directions, who was righteous, a king of the Dharma,

original: po // rin po che sna bdun dang ldan par gyur te /🔽de la bdag gi rin @246a * //
analyzed: po // rin po che sna bdun dang ldan par gyur te / de la bdag gi rin @246a * //
translated: He became endowed with the seven treasures.

original: po che sna bdun ni 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin dag byung ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: po che sna bdun ni 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin dag byung ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: “I had these kinds of seven treasures:

original: 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / nor bu rin po che dang / bud med rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang / dmag dpon rin po che rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / nor bu rin po che dang / bud med rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang / dmag dpon rin po che rnams so //
translated: the precious wheel, the precious elephant, the precious horse, the precious wife, the precious jewel, the precious steward, and the precious minister.🔽He had a full one thousand sons,

original: dpa' brtul phod pa /
analyzed: dpa' brtul phod pa /
translated: who were brave, heroic, and powerful,

original: yan lag mchog gi gzugs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yan lag mchog gi gzugs dang ldan pa /
translated: with the bodies of excellent, superior beings,

original: pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'joms pa'i bu stong du tshang ba yang byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'joms pa'i bu stong du tshang ba yang byung bar gyur to //
translated: who were able to conquer the armies of others.

original: rgya mtsho la thug pa'i sa chen po 'di ma lus par gnod pa med cing 'tshe ba med pa la dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha med la chos kyis rnam par rgyal nas gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho la thug pa'i sa chen po 'di ma lus par gnod pa med cing 'tshe ba med pa la dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha med la chos kyis rnam par rgyal nas gnas par gyur to //
translated: He ruled over this great earth, as far as the ocean, without relying on violence or weapons, but with Dharma.

original: bdag ni bsod snyoms gcig po de'i rnam par smin pas da ltar sh'akya'i rigs phyug po rnams su skyes te brgya phrag du ma dang / stong phrag du ma dang / brgya stong phrag du ma'i gser dang sa le sbram dag btang nas rab tu byung na /
analyzed: bdag ni bsod snyoms gcig po de'i rnam par smin pas da ltar sh'akya'i rigs phyug po rnams su skyes te brgya phrag du ma dang / stong phrag du ma dang / brgya stong phrag du ma'i gser dang sa le sbram dag btang nas rab tu byung na /
translated: I was born into a wealthy Śākya family as a result of that single act of generosity. I gave away hundreds, thousands, and hundreds of thousands of gold coins and pieces of silk.

original: dngos po ngan pa gzhan lta smos kyang ci zhig dgos //
analyzed: dngos po ngan pa gzhan lta smos kyang ci zhig dgos //
translated: What need is there to speak of other inferior things?

original: bdag ni bsod snyoms gcig po de'i rnam par smin pas don du gnyer ba dang tshegs chung dus chos gos yongs su longs spyod cing bsod snyoms dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad dag don du gnyer ba dang tshegs chung dus yongs su longs spyod do //
analyzed: bdag ni bsod snyoms gcig po de'i rnam par smin pas don du gnyer ba dang tshegs chung dus chos gos yongs su longs spyod cing bsod snyoms dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad dag don du gnyer ba dang tshegs chung dus yongs su longs spyod do //
translated: I enjoy Dharma robes, alms, medicine for the sick, bedding, seats, and all the necessities of life with little difficulty or hardship, because of the maturation of that single act of generosity.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis bcom ldan 'das de de ltar mthu dang byin rlabs che bar shes nas bya ba mang du byed par 'gyur ba'i gnas yod cing skabs yod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis bcom ldan 'das de de ltar mthu dang byin rlabs che bar shes nas bya ba mang du byed par 'gyur ba'i gnas yod cing skabs yod do //
translated: Venerable Ones, since I know that the Blessed One has such great power and blessing, there is a possibility that I will do many things.

original: gang yang nyes par spyad pa rnam pa gsum las bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang nyes par spyad pa rnam pa gsum las bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the three types of misconduct, the Blessed One said...

original: dbyangs dang bcas dang nye ba 'khor //
analyzed: dbyangs dang bcas dang nye ba 'khor //
translated: With melody, Upāli,

original: brgya byin gyis lan sa ga dang // sum cu dpe dang de yi phyed //
analyzed: brgya byin gyis lan sa ga dang // sum cu dpe dang de yi phyed //
translated: Śakra's reply, the example of the thirty, and half of that,

original: tshoms su yang dag bsdebs pa yin //
analyzed: tshoms su yang dag bsdebs pa yin //
translated: Are well-arranged in the chapter.

original: zhes bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i nye ba 'khor gyi mdo las te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i nye ba 'khor gyi mdo las te /
translated: This is the summary verse of the second chapter.

original: de nas khyim bdag nye bar 'khor gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bus brtson par byas pas na len drar 'ongs te /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag nye bar 'khor gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bus brtson par byas pas na len drar 'ongs te /
translated: Then the householder Upāli, having been diligent by the Nirgrantha Jñātiputra, came to Pāṭaliputra,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: and approached where the Blessed One was.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs @246b byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go / phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas khyim bdag nye ba 'khor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs @246b byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go / phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas khyim bdag nye ba 'khor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat down to one side, the householder Upasena said to the Blessed One,

original: goo ta ma gal te skabs 'byed na phyogs 'ga' zhig 'dri'o //
analyzed: goo ta ma gal te skabs 'byed na phyogs 'ga' zhig 'dri'o //
translated: “Gautama, if you have the time, I would like to ask you about a few things.”

original: khyim bdag ji ltar bzod pa bzhin du dris shig /
analyzed: khyim bdag ji ltar bzod pa bzhin du dris shig /
translated: “Householder, ask whatever you like.”

original: goo ta ma gcer bu dka' thub can yun ring po nas 'ongs sam /
analyzed: goo ta ma gcer bu dka' thub can yun ring po nas 'ongs sam /
translated: “Gautama, have the naked ascetics been here for long?”

original: khyim bdag 'ongs so //
analyzed: khyim bdag 'ongs so //
translated: “Householder, they have.”

original: goo ta ma yun ring po'i gcer bu dka' thub can dang goo ta ma lhan cig bar skabs su gtam gzhan brjod pa dag byung bar gyur tam /
analyzed: goo ta ma yun ring po'i gcer bu dka' thub can dang goo ta ma lhan cig bar skabs su gtam gzhan brjod pa dag byung bar gyur tam /
translated: “Gautama, have you had any conversations with the naked ascetics?”

original: khyim bdag byung ngo //
analyzed: khyim bdag byung ngo //
translated: “Householder, we have.”

original: goo ta ma de'i phyir goo ta ma dang yun ring por gcer bu dka' thub can lhan cig bar skabs su gzhan brjod pa byung ba de dag thams cad rgyas par bdag la bshad du gsol //
analyzed: goo ta ma de'i phyir goo ta ma dang yun ring por gcer bu dka' thub can lhan cig bar skabs su gzhan brjod pa byung ba de dag thams cad rgyas par bdag la bshad du gsol //
translated: “Gautama, for that reason, please explain in detail to me all the other things that you and the naked ascetics have discussed over a long period of time.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yun ring por gcer bu dka' thub can dang bar skabs su gtam gzhan brjod pa de thams cad khyim bdag nye bar 'khor la rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yun ring por gcer bu dka' thub can dang bar skabs su gtam gzhan brjod pa de thams cad khyim bdag nye bar 'khor la rgyas par bshad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One explained in detail to the householder Upāli all the other things that he had discussed over a long period of time with the naked ascetics.

original: bshad nas khyim bdag nye bar 'khor yid dga' zhing rab tu dga' nas lus kyi stod bteg nas lag pa g-yas pa brkyang nas ched du brjod pa 'di skad du ched du brjod de /
analyzed: bshad nas khyim bdag nye bar 'khor yid dga' zhing rab tu dga' nas lus kyi stod bteg nas lag pa g-yas pa brkyang nas ched du brjod pa 'di skad du ched du brjod de /
translated: After he had explained them, the householder Upāli was delighted and overjoyed. He raised his upper body, extended his right arm, and exclaimed:

original: dka' thub can legs so //
analyzed: dka' thub can legs so //
translated: “Excellent, ascetic!

original: ji ltar ston pa'i nyan thos mkhas pa gsal ba dul ba mi 'jigs par smra ba /
analyzed: ji ltar ston pa'i nyan thos mkhas pa gsal ba dul ba mi 'jigs par smra ba /
translated: Just as the learned, clear, disciplined, and fearless disciples of the Teacher

original: ston pa'i bstan pa shes pas las kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad las kha na ma tho ba chen po nyid du bcas shing ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa shes pas las kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad las kha na ma tho ba chen po nyid du bcas shing ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: Because he knows the Teacher’s teaching, he has declared that all physical misconduct is a great sin, but not so for verbal and mental misconduct.

original: dag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa ro dang 'dra bas ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes lus kyi nyes par spyad pa las brtsams te rags pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: dag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa ro dang 'dra bas ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes lus kyi nyes par spyad pa las brtsams te rags pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: What will verbal and mental misconduct do, since they are like a flavor? Thus, beginning with physical misconduct, he has taught that it is gross.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag nye bar 'khor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag nye bar 'khor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the householder Upāli:

original: de nas khyim bdag khyod bdag dang lhan cig 'di na bar skabs kyi gtam brjod pa ni de gal te khyod kyis bden par rtog cing bzod la mi khro 'am /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag khyod bdag dang lhan cig 'di na bar skabs kyi gtam brjod pa ni de gal te khyod kyis bden par rtog cing bzod la mi khro 'am /
translated: “Householder, if you can bear it, if you are not angry, then you and I can discuss this matter.

original: bdag goo ta ma khyod dang lhan cig bar skabs kyi gtam gzhan brjod pa na bdag bcom ldan 'das la bden par rtog cing bzod la mi khro'o //
analyzed: bdag goo ta ma khyod dang lhan cig bar skabs kyi gtam gzhan brjod pa na bdag bcom ldan 'das la bden par rtog cing bzod la mi khro'o //
translated: “Gautama, I can bear it, I am not angry, if I discuss this matter with you.”

original: khyim bdag 'di lta ste gcer bu pa thun bzhi pa thun bzhi pa'i sdom pa can de 'gro ba na srog chags @247a * //
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di lta ste gcer bu pa thun bzhi pa thun bzhi pa'i sdom pa can de 'gro ba na srog chags @247a * //
translated: Householder, it is like this: When a naked ascetic who practices the four abodes of Brahmā and observes the four abodes of Brahmā goes, I go.🔽🔽

original: phra zhing phra mo'i tshogs dag mang po dag 'tsho ba dang phral te /
analyzed: phra zhing phra mo'i tshogs dag mang po dag 'tsho ba dang phral te /
translated: “Householder, it is like this: when the naked ascetic Cunda, who practices the four abodes, goes for a walk, he takes the lives of many thousands of tiny creatures.

original: gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu de'i 'bras bu ni ci zhig rnam par smin pa ni ci zhig yin par shes /
analyzed: gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu de'i 'bras bu ni ci zhig rnam par smin pa ni ci zhig yin par shes /
translated: “Householder, what is the fruit of the naked ascetic Cunda, the son of Gaṇaka, and what is its ripening?”

original: goo ta ma bsams bzhin du byas pas kha na ma tho ba chen por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goo ta ma bsams bzhin du byas pas kha na ma tho ba chen por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Gautama, if it is done intentionally, it is not a great offense.”

original: gal te bsams bzhin du na ni kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bsams bzhin du na ni kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: “If it is done intentionally, it is a great offense.”

original: khyim bdag bsams bzhin du zhes bya ba gang la bya /
analyzed: khyim bdag bsams bzhin du zhes bya ba gang la bya /
translated: “Householder, what is meant by ‘intentionally’?”

original: goo ta ma yid kyi las so //
analyzed: goo ta ma yid kyi las so //
translated: “Gautama, it is mental action.”

original: khyim bdag yid kyis byas pa yid kyis byas pa zhes lung ston na snga ma dang phyi ma mi mthun zhing phyi ma dang snga ma mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag yid kyis byas pa yid kyis byas pa zhes lung ston na snga ma dang phyi ma mi mthun zhing phyi ma dang snga ma mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Householder, if you declare that mental action is mental action, then the former and the latter are not in agreement, and the latter and the former are not in agreement.”

original: 'khor gyi nang du 'di lta bu'i ngo bo bshad de /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du 'di lta bu'i ngo bo bshad de /
translated: “This is the kind of explanation that should be given in the midst of an assembly.”

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad las kha na ma tho ba chen po ste /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad las kha na ma tho ba chen po ste /
translated: All physical misdeeds are grave offenses.

original: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ni de lta ma yin te /🔽ngag gis nyes par spyod pa ro dang 'dra ba dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ro dang 'dra ba dag gis ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes lus kyis nyes par spyod pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ni de lta ma yin te / ngag gis nyes par spyod pa ro dang 'dra ba dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ro dang 'dra ba dag gis ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes lus kyis nyes par spyod pa las brtsams te /
translated: Verbal and mental misdeeds are not like that.🔽What can be done with verbal misdeeds that are like a corpse and mental misdeeds that are like a corpse?

original: kha na ma tho ba rags pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba rags pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, beginning with physical misdeeds, the Buddha taught that they are grave offenses.

original: 'di lta ste khyim bdag gcer bu pa thun bzhi pa thun bzhi pa'i sdom pa can chu dron mo rdeg cing chu grang mo mi 'dod pa de 'chi ba'i dus na chu grang mo 'dod kyang chu grang mo ma rnyed nas dus byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste khyim bdag gcer bu pa thun bzhi pa thun bzhi pa'i sdom pa can chu dron mo rdeg cing chu grang mo mi 'dod pa de 'chi ba'i dus na chu grang mo 'dod kyang chu grang mo ma rnyed nas dus byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, a naked ascetic householder who practices the four periods of standing, sitting, etc., who heats up hot water and does not want cold water, when dying desires cold water but does not find any and dies.🔽What is the destiny of that naked ascetic son of a friend?

original: gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu de'i 'gro ba ni gang skye ba ni gang /
analyzed: gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu de'i 'gro ba ni gang skye ba ni gang /
translated: What is his rebirth?

original: 'jig rten pha rol du gdags pa ni gang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du gdags pa ni gang /
translated: What is his designation in the next world?

original: goo ta ma yid chags pa zhes bya ba ni lha gang na ba der skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goo ta ma yid chags pa zhes bya ba ni lha gang na ba der skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The one called Gautama, who is attached to the mind, will be reborn among the gods.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i sems de la bcings bzhin du dus las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sems de la bcings bzhin du dus las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because his mind is bound to that object, and he has passed beyond the time.

original: khyim bdag yid kyis byas pa yid kyis byas pa zhes lung ston na snga ma dang phyi ma mi mthun zhing phyi ma dang snga ma mi mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyim bdag yid kyis byas pa yid kyis byas pa zhes lung ston na snga ma dang phyi ma mi mthun zhing phyi ma dang snga ma mi mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: Householder, if you prophesy that what is done by the mind is done by the mind, then the former and latter are inconsistent, and the latter and former are inconsistent.

original: 'khor gyi nang du 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin bshad de /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin bshad de /
translated: In the midst of the assembly, you explain this kind of nature:

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad las kha na ma tho ba chen po ste /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad las kha na ma tho ba chen po ste /
translated: All bodily misconduct is a great offense,

original: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: but verbal misconduct and mental misconduct are not like that.

original: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa ro dang 'dra ba dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ro dang 'dra ba dag gis ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes lus kyis nyes par spyod pa las brtsams te kha na ma tho ba rags pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa ro dang 'dra ba dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa ro dang 'dra ba dag gis ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes lus kyis nyes par spyod pa las brtsams te kha na ma tho ba rags pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: What will you do with verbal misdeeds that are like a corpse and mental misdeeds that are like a corpse?” Thus, beginning with physical misdeeds, he taught the coarseness of the vile actions.

original: khyim bdag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di lta ste /
translated: “Householder, it is like this:

original: na @247b lendra 'di ltar 'byor pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang bar gyur la /
analyzed: na @247b lendra 'di ltar 'byor pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang bar gyur la /
translated: Narendra, in this way, it is prosperous, flourishing, happy, with good harvests, and filled with many people.

original: de nas lag na ral gri dang phub thogs pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig 'ongs nas 'di skad du 'di ltar na lendra 'di ltar 'byor pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba 'di nyin zhag gcig la brlag cing nyams par
analyzed: de nas lag na ral gri dang phub thogs pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig 'ongs nas 'di skad du 'di ltar na lendra 'di ltar 'byor pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba 'di nyin zhag gcig la brlag cing nyams par
translated: Then, some people come with swords and spears in their hands and say, ‘In this way, Narendra, this prosperous, flourishing, happy, with good harvests, and filled with many people, in one day it will be destroyed, ruined,🔽and empty.

original: bya'o // don ma yin pas phongs par bya'o zhes smra na khyim bdag 'di lta bu sems pa'i skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa des na lendra 'di ltar 'byor pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba 'di nyin zhag gcig la brlag
analyzed: bya'o // don ma yin pas phongs par bya'o zhes smra na khyim bdag 'di lta bu sems pa'i skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa des na lendra 'di ltar 'byor pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba 'di nyin zhag gcig la brlag
translated: I will destroy it. I will bring about its ruin and loss.

original: pa dang nyams pa dang don ma yin pas phongs par bya bar nus sam /
analyzed: pa dang nyams pa dang don ma yin pas phongs par bya bar nus sam /
translated: If such a powerful man were to think like that, would he be able to destroy, ruin, and bring about the loss and ruin of this prosperous, flourishing, happy, well-watered, and populous city of Rājagṛha in a single day?”

original: goo ta ma ma lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma ma lags so //
translated: “Gautama, he would not be able to do so.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: na lendra 'di ltar 'byor pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba 'di tshegs chung dus skyes bu gcig gis brlag pa dang nyams pa dang don ma yin pas phongs par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: na lendra 'di ltar 'byor pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba 'di tshegs chung dus skyes bu gcig gis brlag pa dang nyams pa dang don ma yin pas phongs par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: “Gautama, this prosperous, flourishing, happy, well-watered, and populous city of Rājagṛha cannot be destroyed, ruined, and brought about the loss and ruin by a single man with little effort.

original: gnyis dang gsum dang bdun gyis kyang brlag pa dang nyams pa dang / don ma yin pas phongs par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gnyis dang gsum dang bdun gyis kyang brlag pa dang nyams pa dang / don ma yin pas phongs par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be destroyed, ruined, and brought about the loss and ruin by two, three, or even seven men.

original: gzhan du na skyes bu de ni phongs shing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: gzhan du na skyes bu de ni phongs shing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur lags so //
translated: Otherwise, that person would be unfortunate and miserable.

original: khyim bdag 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di lta ste ;
translated: Householder, it is like this:

original: na lendra 'di ltar 'byor cing rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang bar gyur la phyi rol du mu stegs pa'i drang srong rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa sems la dbang thob pa 'ga' zhig 'ongs nas 'di skad du na lendra 'byor
analyzed: na lendra 'di ltar 'byor cing rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang bar gyur la phyi rol du mu stegs pa'i drang srong rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa sems la dbang thob pa 'ga' zhig 'ongs nas 'di skad du na lendra 'byor
translated: In Rājagṛha, in this way, prosperous, flourishing, happy, with plenty of food, and full of many people, if some non-Buddhist sages with magical powers and control over their minds were to come and say, 'Rājagṛha, which is prosperous,

original: pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba de yid skad cig tsam khros pas brlag par bya'o //
analyzed: pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba de yid skad cig tsam khros pas brlag par bya'o //
translated: flourishing, happy, with plenty of food, and full of many people, we will destroy it in an instant with anger.

original: nyams pa dang don ma yin pas phongs par bya'o //
analyzed: nyams pa dang don ma yin pas phongs par bya'o //
translated: We will cause it to decline and be unfortunate.

original: thal bar bya'o zhes smra na /
analyzed: thal bar bya'o zhes smra na /
translated: We will reduce it to ashes,'

original: khyim bdag 'di ci snyam du sems /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di ci snyam du sems /
translated: Householder, what do you think?

original: stobs dang ldan pa'i phyi rol mu stegs pa'i drang srong rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa sems la dbang thob pa des na lendra 'di ltar 'byor pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba 'di skad cig tsam yid khros pas brlag
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i phyi rol mu stegs pa'i drang srong rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa sems la dbang thob pa des na lendra 'di ltar 'byor pa rgyas pa bde ba lo legs pa skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba 'di skad cig tsam yid khros pas brlag
translated: “Gautama, can a powerful non-Buddhist sage with supernormal powers and mental control destroy, ruin, and reduce to ashes this prosperous, flourishing, happy, well-watered, and populous city of Nalanda with a mere angry thought?”🔽“Gautama, a powerful non-Buddhist sage with supernormal powers and mental control could burn down Nalanda with a mere angry thought, not to mention a city like Nalanda, a town, a village, or a country.”🔽“Gautama, a powerful non-Buddhist sage with supernormal powers and mental control could burn down Nalanda with a mere angry thought, not to mention a city like Nalanda, a town, a village, or a country.”

analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin bshad de /

original: khyim bdag dbyig pa can gyi dgon pa dang / ka ling ka'i dgon pa dang / ma tang ka'i dgon pa de stong par gyur cing dgon par gyur pa dag 'ga' zhig las thos sam /

original: goo ta ma thos lags so //
analyzed: goo ta ma thos lags so //
translated: “Gautama, I have heard.”

original: dbyig pa can gyi dgon pa dang / ka ling ka'i dgon pa dang ma tang ka'i dgon pa de dag cis stong par gyur cing dgon par gyur /
analyzed: dbyig pa can gyi dgon pa dang / ka ling ka'i dgon pa dang ma tang ka'i dgon pa de dag cis stong par gyur cing dgon par gyur /

analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / khyim bdag nye ba 'khor cang mi smra bar gyur to //
translated: When this was said, Upāli the householder remained silent.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag nye ba 'khor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Upāli the householder,

original: khyim bdag lung ston cig / lung ston cing //
analyzed: khyim bdag lung ston cig / lung ston cing //

analyzed: goo ta ma bdag don 'di nyid sems shing kha rog 'dug ste /

analyzed: ji ltar da ltar bdag gcer bu pa byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas pas yun ring por bdag bslus so //
translated: “How long have I been deceived by this naked, foolish, ignorant, unskillful body,

original: bsgribs shing 'khrul du bcug ste /
analyzed: bsgribs shing 'khrul du bcug ste /

original: 'di skad du lus kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad la kha na ma tho ba chen po ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du lus kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad la kha na ma tho ba chen po ste /

translated: but not so for verbal and mental misconduct.🔽What will I do with physical misconduct, which is like a corpse, and verbal and mental misconduct, which are also like corpses?

original: kha na ma tho ba rags pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba rags pa nyid du bstan to //

analyzed: 'di nas bzung ste goo ta ma la mngon par dad do //

analyzed: log par lta ba kha na ma tho ba chen po yin no zhes bya ba la /

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //

analyzed: dge slong dag med par lta ba ni kha na ma tho ba chen po ste /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: For a person with wrong views, all physical actions, and likewise all verbal actions, mental actions, aims, aspirations, and phenomena that follow from that are established as undesirable,

analyzed: mi sdug pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / yid du mi 'od ba dang / yid du mi 'thad pa dang / mngon par mi dga' ba nyid sgrub par byed pa ste /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: lta ba de ni sdig pa can te 'di ltar log par lta ba'o //

original: 'di lta ste nim pa'i sa bon nam /
analyzed: 'di lta ste nim pa'i sa bon nam /

analyzed: ku ba khan te ma'i sa bon nam /

analyzed: chu'i ni chus /

original: me'i ni mes /
analyzed: me'i ni mes /

analyzed: rlung gi ni rlung gis blangs nas de thams cad kha ba dang tsha ba dang ro med pa can du 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de bzhin du log par lta ba ni mchog tu kha na ma tho ba chen po'o //
translated: In the same way, wrong view is the worst of all the bad actions.

translated: The physical actions of a person with wrong view, and likewise the verbal and mental actions, the aims, the prayers, and the phenomena of formations that are in accord with that all lead to the manifestation of what is unwanted.

analyzed: mi sdug pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'thad pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa ste /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lta ba de ni sdig pa can te 'di ltar log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba de ni sdig pa can te 'di ltar log par lta ba'o //
translated: Because that view is sinful, and thus it is a wrong view.

original: dge slong dag yang dag pa'i lta ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i mchog ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag yang dag pa'i lta ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i mchog ste /

original: de ci'i phyir @249a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir @249a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: zhe na ; yang dag par lta ba can gyi skyes bu'i lus kyi las dang / ngag dang yid kyi las kyang de'i don du gnyer ba dang / smon lam dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos 'du byed thams cad kyang 'dod pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa sdug pa dang dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba dang yid du 'thad pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa ste /

translated: Because the physical, verbal, and mental actions of a person who has right view are in accordance with that view, and all the conditioned phenomena that are in accordance with that view are the cause for the production of what is pleasant, desirable, agreeable, and appealing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: 'di ltar lta ba de ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar lta ba de ni dge ba'o //

original: rgun 'bru'i sa bon dag zhing bzang zhing gshin pa la btab na de'i gang dang gang gi sa'i bcud ni sas len cing /
analyzed: rgun 'bru'i sa bon dag zhing bzang zhing gshin pa la btab na de'i gang dang gang gi sa'i bcud ni sas len cing /

original: chu'i ni chus /
analyzed: chu'i ni chus /

original: me'i ni mes /

analyzed: sdug pa dang dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba dang yid du 'thad pa sgrub par byed pa ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar yang /

original: lta ba de ni dge ba'o //

analyzed: sman pa'i chos ni bstan mi bya //

original: bag med pa dang gnas mi bya //
analyzed: bag med pa dang gnas mi bya //

original: 'jig rten 'phel bar mi bya ste //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'phel bar mi bya ste //

original: log par lta can 'dod mi bya //
analyzed: log par lta can 'dod mi bya //

original: 'jig rten pa yi yang dag lta //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi yang dag lta //

analyzed: chen po gang la yod gyur pa //

translated: The Blessed One was traveling from town to town, from country to country, from kingdom to kingdom, together with a large saṅgha of thirteen and a half hundred monks, a thousand male and female lay followers, and about five hundred alms-beggars.

analyzed: de'i tshen mu ge chen po rgal bar dka' zhing slong mo pas zas dag rnyed par dka' ba byung bar gyur to //
