translated: The naked ascetics said to the village chief who was holding a sword, Village chief!🔽Can you debate with the ascetic Gautama, who is like a lump of iron with two holes, in such a way that he cannot answer and cannot avoid answering?🔽 The village chief said, Noble ones, how can I debate with the ascetic Gautama, who is like a lump of iron with two holes, in such a way that he cannot answer and cannot avoid answering?

original: lung bstan par bya ba ma yin par yang mi nus pa'i rtsod pa dag ji ltar lags /
analyzed: lung bstan par bya ba ma yin par yang mi nus pa'i rtsod pa dag ji ltar lags /
translated: The naked ascetics said, Village chief, if you debate with the ascetic Gautama in this way, he will not be able to answer and will not be able to avoid answering.

original: grong dpon khyod dge sbyong goo ta ma gang na ba der nya bar song la nye bar song nas 'di skad ces smros shig / dge sbyong goo ta ma khyod khyim gyi skye ba sems sam khyim gyi bsngags pa dag rjod par byed dam /
analyzed: grong dpon khyod dge sbyong goo ta ma gang na ba der nya bar song la nye bar song nas 'di skad ces smros shig / dge sbyong goo ta ma khyod khyim gyi skye ba sems sam khyim gyi bsngags pa dag rjod par byed dam /
translated: “Go to the ascetic Gautama, headman, and when you get there, say this to him: ‘Gautama, do you think of householders or do you praise householders?

original: gal te de ma yin no zhes zer na 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de ma yin no zhes zer na 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: If he says, “No,” then say this:

original: de ltar na goo ta ma khyod dang phyis byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de ltar na goo ta ma khyod dang phyis byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: “In that case, Gautama, what is the difference between you and all the childish ordinary beings?”

original: gal te de de bzhin no zhes zer na 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de de bzhin no zhes zer na 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: If he says, “That is so,” then say this:

original: dge sbyong goo ta ma khyod da ltar mu ge chen po rgal bar dka' zhing slong mo pas zas dag rnyed par dka' ba byung ba na dge slong gi dge 'dun mang po brgya phrag phyed dang bcu gsum gyi dge slong dang dge bsnyen stong dang slong mo
analyzed: dge sbyong goo ta ma khyod da ltar mu ge chen po rgal bar dka' zhing slong mo pas zas dag rnyed par dka' ba byung ba na dge slong gi dge 'dun mang po brgya phrag phyed dang bcu gsum gyi dge slong dang dge bsnyen stong dang slong mo
translated: “Gautama, now that a great famine has arisen, making it difficult to get by and difficult for beggars to get food, you have a large saṅgha of one thousand five hundred monks and lay followers who beg for alms

original: za ba lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig tu grong nas grong du grong khyer nas grong khyer du ljongs nas ljongs su rgyu zhing goo ta ma khyim rnams la ser ba bzhin du rgyu zhing gnod pa byed la khyim gyi skye bo 'joms par byed de /
analyzed: za ba lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig tu grong nas grong du grong khyer nas grong khyer du ljongs nas ljongs su rgyu zhing goo ta ma khyim rnams la ser ba bzhin du rgyu zhing gnod pa byed la khyim gyi skye bo 'joms par byed de /
translated: Together with about five hundred followers, he went from town to town, from city to city, from country to country, and like hail to the fields, he went about harming the Gotama family and destroying the family.

original: goo ta ma 'di ni mi rigs pa 'di ni mi 'dra ba 'di ni mi 'thad pa'o zhes grong dpon 'di skad du smras na ngos gnyis na bu ga yod pa'i @250a * //
analyzed: goo ta ma 'di ni mi rigs pa 'di ni mi 'dra ba 'di ni mi 'thad pa'o zhes grong dpon 'di skad du smras na ngos gnyis na bu ga yod pa'i @250a * //
translated: When the village headman said, Gotama, this is improper, this is unlike you, this is not reasonable, the two sides argued, saying, This is like a lump of iron with holes on both sides.

original: lcags kyi thu lum lta bu 'di dge sbyong goo ta mas dris na lung bstan par yang mi nus bstan par bya ba ma yin par yang mi nus pa'i rtsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lcags kyi thu lum lta bu 'di dge sbyong goo ta mas dris na lung bstan par yang mi nus bstan par bya ba ma yin par yang mi nus pa'i rtsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the ascetic Gotama asks about this, we will not be able to answer, and we will not be able to say it should not be explained.

original: 'phags pa dag nus lags so //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag nus lags so //
translated: The noble ones are able.

original: de nas gcer bu pa'i nyan thos grong dpon lag na ral gri thogs pa gcer bu pas bskul nas na lendra gang na ba der song ste /
analyzed: de nas gcer bu pa'i nyan thos grong dpon lag na ral gri thogs pa gcer bu pas bskul nas na lendra gang na ba der song ste /
translated: Then the village headman, a disciple of the naked ascetics, armed with a sword, urged on by the naked ascetics, went to Nalanda.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang yang dag par bde bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang yang dag par bde bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go ;
translated: He approached the Blessed One and, after engaging in some pleasant and polite conversation with him, sat down to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas grong dpon lag na ral gri thogs pa des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas grong dpon lag na ral gri thogs pa des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Once he had sat down to one side, the village overseer Sthūlakoṣṭhila said to the Blessed One,

original: goo ta ma khyod khyim rnams kyi skye ba rtog par byed dam /
analyzed: goo ta ma khyod khyim rnams kyi skye ba rtog par byed dam /
translated: “Gautama, do you investigate the births of families?

original: khyim dag gi bsngags pa rjod par byed dam /
analyzed: khyim dag gi bsngags pa rjod par byed dam /
translated: Do you praise families?”

original: grong dpon de bzhin gshegs pa ni yun ring mo nas khyim rnams kyi skye ba brtag par mdzad cing khyim rnams kyi bsngags pa rjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: grong dpon de bzhin gshegs pa ni yun ring mo nas khyim rnams kyi skye ba brtag par mdzad cing khyim rnams kyi bsngags pa rjod par mdzad do //
translated: “Village overseer, the Thus-Gone One has long investigated the births of families and praised families.”

original: goo ta ma khyod da ltar mu ge chen po rgal bar dka' zhing slong mo ba dag gis zas dag rnyed par dka' ba byung ba na dge slong gi dge 'dun mang po brgya phrag phyed dang bcu gsum gyi dge slong dang / dge bsnyen stong dang /
analyzed: goo ta ma khyod da ltar mu ge chen po rgal bar dka' zhing slong mo ba dag gis zas dag rnyed par dka' ba byung ba na dge slong gi dge 'dun mang po brgya phrag phyed dang bcu gsum gyi dge slong dang / dge bsnyen stong dang /
translated: “Gautama, now that a great famine has arisen, making it difficult to cross over, and it is difficult for beggars to find food, you are traveling from town to town, from city to city, from country to country, together with a large saṅgha of thirteen hundred and fifty monks,

original: slong mo pa lnga brgya tsam dang thabs gcig tu grong nas grong dang grong khyer nas grong khyer dang / ljongs nas ljongs su rgyu zhing /
analyzed: slong mo pa lnga brgya tsam dang thabs gcig tu grong nas grong dang grong khyer nas grong khyer dang / ljongs nas ljongs su rgyu zhing /
translated: and with five hundred lay followers and beggars.

original: khyim rnams la ser ba bzhin du gnod par byed dam /
analyzed: khyim rnams la ser ba bzhin du gnod par byed dam /
translated: Are you harming the houses like hail?

original: khyim gyi skye ba bcom par byed dam /
analyzed: khyim gyi skye ba bcom par byed dam /
translated: Are you destroying the people in the houses?

original: goo ta ma 'di ni mi rigs pa 'di ni mi 'dra ba 'di ni mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: goo ta ma 'di ni mi rigs pa 'di ni mi 'dra ba 'di ni mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: Gautama, this is unreasonable, this is unseemly, this is unacceptable.

original: grong dpon ngas 'di nas bzung ste bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig yang dag par rjes su dran te /
analyzed: grong dpon ngas 'di nas bzung ste bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig yang dag par rjes su dran te /
translated: Village chief, I remember correctly ninety-one eons from now.

original: zas sbyin pa ster bar bya ba'i phyir khyim gang la yang mi bde ba dang nyam nga ba dang gnod par mngon par mi mkhyen to //
analyzed: zas sbyin pa ster bar bya ba'i phyir khyim gang la yang mi bde ba dang nyam nga ba dang gnod par mngon par mi mkhyen to //
translated: He does not know of any household that is unhappy, distressed, or harmed in order to give food.

original: grong dpon 'on kyang khyed kyis mthong ngam /
analyzed: grong dpon 'on kyang khyed kyis mthong ngam /
translated: “ ‘Householder, do you see

original: khyim rnams phyug pa dang nor mang po dang / yo byad rab tu mang ba dang / pha'i nor mang ba dang / nor dang gser dang sa le sbram dang / mdzod dang bang ba dang khyim gyi tshogs mang po dang / bran pho dang bran mo @250b dang las byed pa'i skyes bu mang po dang /
analyzed: khyim rnams phyug pa dang nor mang po dang / yo byad rab tu mang ba dang / pha'i nor mang ba dang / nor dang gser dang sa le sbram dang / mdzod dang bang ba dang khyim gyi tshogs mang po dang / bran pho dang bran mo @250b dang las byed pa'i skyes bu mang po dang /
translated: the households that are wealthy, have much property, have abundant possessions, have abundant paternal property, have abundant wealth, gold, silver, treasuries, granaries, and household goods, have many male and female servants,

original: gnyen bshes dang / snag gi gnyan mtshams mang po dang ldan pa dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: gnyen bshes dang / snag gi gnyan mtshams mang po dang ldan pa dag mthong ngam /
translated: and have many relatives and kinsmen?

original: de dag ni yun ring po'i dge ba las byung ba /
analyzed: de dag ni yun ring po'i dge ba las byung ba /
translated: They have arisen from virtue accumulated over a long period of time.

original: bden pa las byung ba /
analyzed: bden pa las byung ba /
translated: They have arisen from the truth.

original: nye bar zhi ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba las byung ba'o //
translated: They have arisen from tranquility.

original: grong dpon brgyad po 'di dag ni khyim rnams 'jig cing skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i rkyen brgyad de /
analyzed: grong dpon brgyad po 'di dag ni khyim rnams 'jig cing skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i rkyen brgyad de /
translated: “ ‘Householder, there are eight conditions that cause the destruction of households.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: grong dpon rgyal po ni khyim 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: grong dpon rgyal po ni khyim 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: The householder, the king, the village chief, the destroyer of the household,

original: rkun po dang / me dang / chu dang / gter dang / las kyi mtha' dang / mi dga' bas sgro 'dogs pa dang / bud med gang gis khyim dang / khyim gyi yan lag rnams don ma yin pas phongs par byed cing skyer mi ster ba'o //
analyzed: rkun po dang / me dang / chu dang / gter dang / las kyi mtha' dang / mi dga' bas sgro 'dogs pa dang / bud med gang gis khyim dang / khyim gyi yan lag rnams don ma yin pas phongs par byed cing skyer mi ster ba'o //
translated: the thief, fire, water, the treasure, the work, the accusation of the unpleasant, and the woman who causes the household and the limbs of the household to be deprived of their purpose and not to be produced.

original: grong dpon mi rtag pa zhes bya ba brgyad po yang ngas bstan par byas te /
analyzed: grong dpon mi rtag pa zhes bya ba brgyad po yang ngas bstan par byas te /
translated: The impermanence of the village chief, the eight, I have taught.

original: grong dpon gang kha cig rgyu dang rkyen brgyad po spangs nas 'di skad du dge sbyong goo ta ma ni khyim rnams la gnod par rtog cing skyo bar mi rtog pa'o zhes smra na /
analyzed: grong dpon gang kha cig rgyu dang rkyen brgyad po spangs nas 'di skad du dge sbyong goo ta ma ni khyim rnams la gnod par rtog cing skyo bar mi rtog pa'o zhes smra na /
translated: The village chief, some say, having abandoned the eight causes and conditions, in this way, the śramaṇa Gautama thinks of harm to the household, but does not think of weariness.

original: de'i tshig de lta ba ma spangs shing 'dod pa dang bzod pa dang log pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshig de lta ba ma spangs shing 'dod pa dang bzod pa dang log pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa ste /
translated: The words of that one are not abandoned views, and the desire, patience, and wrong thoughts are not abandoned.

original: mda' thur du 'phangs pa ltar lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mda' thur du 'phangs pa ltar lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Like an arrow shot by a strong archer, he will fall into the lower realms, into the hells.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / grong dpon lag na ral gri thogs pa ngu shing mchi ma 'dzag ste /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / grong dpon lag na ral gri thogs pa ngu shing mchi ma 'dzag ste /
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken, the village chief, holding a sword in his hand, wept and shed tears.

original: de nas grong dpon lag na ral gri thogs pa ngu zhing mchi ma 'dzag bzhin du bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar nas phyag byed cing 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas grong dpon lag na ral gri thogs pa ngu zhing mchi ma 'dzag bzhin du bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar nas phyag byed cing 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the village chief, holding a sword in his hand, wept and shed tears. He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said:

original: bcom ldan 'das sdig pa bgyis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sdig pa bgyis so //
translated: “Blessed One, I have committed a sin!

original: bde bar gshegs pa sdig pa bgyis so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa sdig pa bgyis so //
translated: Sugata, I have committed a sin!

original: ji ltar byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas par gyur pas goo ta ma la mi bden pa gsog brdzun du smra bas smad par bgyis so //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas par gyur pas goo ta ma la mi bden pa gsog brdzun du smra bas smad par bgyis so //
translated: Like a foolish, confused, unclear, and unskilled child, I have lied and slandered Gautama with false, deceptive speech.

original: goo ta ma de bdag gis sdig par mthong zhing sdig par shes nas mthol lags te /
analyzed: goo ta ma de bdag gis sdig par mthong zhing sdig par shes nas mthol lags te /
translated: Gautama, I see that sin and recognize it as a sin. I confess it

original: goo ta ma bdag la thugs brtse bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: goo ta ma bdag la thugs brtse bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: Gautama, please have compassion for me.

original: grong dpon bden te sdig pa la sdig par mthong nas sdig par bshags sam /
analyzed: grong dpon bden te sdig pa la sdig par mthong nas sdig par bshags sam /
translated: “Gautama, it is true. Having seen evil as evil, I confess my evil.

original: ji ltar byis pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas par gyur pas @251a * //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas par gyur pas @251a * //
translated: Gautama, because I was ignorant, unskillful,

original: goo ta ma la mi bden pa gsog brdzun du smra bas smad par byas pa de gang gi phyir grong dpon khyod kyis mi rigs par mthong zhing mthong nas bshags te /
analyzed: goo ta ma la mi bden pa gsog brdzun du smra bas smad par byas pa de gang gi phyir grong dpon khyod kyis mi rigs par mthong zhing mthong nas bshags te /
translated: and foolish, I slandered Gautama with lies and untruths. Having seen that, headman, as improper, you confess it and

original: phyis mi byed pa'i sdom pa 'dzin na mi 'phel zhing spong la dge ba'i chos rnams nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis mi byed pa'i sdom pa 'dzin na mi 'phel zhing spong la dge ba'i chos rnams nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: do not do it again. If you restrain yourself, it will not increase, but will diminish. You will not lose any wholesome qualities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: grong dpon gang kha cig sdig pa la sdig par mthong zhing shes nas mthol zhing phyis mi byed pa'i sdom pa 'dzin na mi 'phel zhing spong la dge ba'i chos rnams nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grong dpon gang kha cig sdig pa la sdig par mthong zhing shes nas mthol zhing phyis mi byed pa'i sdom pa 'dzin na mi 'phel zhing spong la dge ba'i chos rnams nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Headman, if someone sees evil as evil, understands it as evil, confesses it, and restrains themselves from doing it again, it will not increase, but will diminish. They will not lose any wholesome qualities.

original: de nas grong dpon lag na ral gri thogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rangs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo //
analyzed: de nas grong dpon lag na ral gri thogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rangs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo //
translated: Then the village overseer, holding a sword in his hand, rejoiced in and praised the words of the Blessed One, and departed from the Blessed One’s presence.

original: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three types of bases of meritorious action

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The frame story is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
translated: “Monks, there are these three types of bases of meritorious action.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: The bases of meritorious action arisen from giving, the bases of meritorious action arisen from morality, and the bases of meritorious action arisen from meditation.

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of meritorious action arisen from giving?

original: kha cig sbyin pa por gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig sbyin pa por gyur te /
translated: Some become givers.

original: dge sbyong ngam bram ze dang snying rje ba dang slong ba dang lam du zhugs pa dag la 'di lta ste zas dang ston mo dang gos dang phreng ba dang dri dang byug pa dang khri dang sgron ma dag sbyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam bram ze dang snying rje ba dang slong ba dang lam du zhugs pa dag la 'di lta ste zas dang ston mo dang gos dang phreng ba dang dri dang byug pa dang khri dang sgron ma dag sbyin par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the giving of food, drink, clothing, vehicles, garlands, fragrances, ointments, bedding, and lamps to ascetics and brahmins, to the poor, to beggars, and to travelers.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the meritorious work consisting of giving.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meritorious work consisting of morality?

original: 'di na kha cig srog gcod pa spong zhing srog gcod pa las log pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas spong zhing 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas las log par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di na kha cig srog gcod pa spong zhing srog gcod pa las log pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas spong zhing 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas las log par gyur pa'o //
translated: Here someone, abandoning the killing of living beings, abstains from the killing of living beings; abandoning the taking of what has not been given, he abstains from taking what has not been given; abandoning sexual misconduct, he abstains from sexual misconduct; abandoning false speech, he abstains from false speech; abandoning wines, liquors, and intoxicants which cause heedlessness, he abstains from wines, liquors, and intoxicants that cause heedlessness.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the meritorious work consisting of morality.

original: bsgoms @251b pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms @251b pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meritorious work consisting of meditation?

original: 'di na kha cig byams pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i sems kho na med pa 'gran zla med pa gnod pa med pa yangs pa thams cad du khyab pa tshad med pa legs par bsgoms pas phyogs gcig tu rgyas par khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas
analyzed: 'di na kha cig byams pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i sems kho na med pa 'gran zla med pa gnod pa med pa yangs pa thams cad du khyab pa tshad med pa legs par bsgoms pas phyogs gcig tu rgyas par khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas
translated: Here someone, by means of meditation on loving-kindness, fills one quarter of the world with a mind that is full of loving-kindness, without hatred, without enmity, without rivalry, without hostility, extending, growing great, measureless, well-developed, and well-completed.

original: so // de bzhin du gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang steng dang 'og dang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten thams cad byams pa dang / lhan cig pa'i sems kho na med pa 'gran zla med pa gnod pa med pa /🔽yangs pa thams cad du khyab pa tshang med pa legs par bsgoms pas rgyas par khyab par byas te bsgrubs nas gnas so //
analyzed: so // de bzhin du gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang steng dang 'og dang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten thams cad byams pa dang / lhan cig pa'i sems kho na med pa 'gran zla med pa gnod pa med pa /🔽yangs pa thams cad du khyab pa tshang med pa legs par bsgoms pas rgyas par khyab par byas te bsgrubs nas gnas so //
translated: In the same way, he fills the second, the third and the fourth quarter of the world with a mind that is full of loving-kindness, without hatred, without enmity, without rivalry, without hostility, extending, growing great, measureless, well-developed, and well-completed.🔽In the same way, he fills the whole world with a mind that is full of loving-kindness, without hatred, without enmity, without rivalry, without hostility, extending, growing great, measureless, well-developed, and well-completed.

translated: In the same way, he dwells having completely achieved and abided in the meditative development of the immeasurable thoughts of equanimity, which is not vacant, not rivalled, not harmful, vast, all-pervading and immeasurable, having made it grow and expand in the second, third and fourth directions, above, below and across, in all ten directions of the world-realms.

original: dge slong dag 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa 'di lta bur re bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa 'di lta bur re bar bya'o //

original: de la gal te 'di lta bu'i sbyin pa kha dog dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gal te 'di lta bu'i sbyin pa kha dog dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
translated: If one gives gifts of this kind, of perfect color and smell,

original: ro phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa de lta bu'i ngo bo'i sbyin pa dag sbyin par byed na phyug por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ro phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa de lta bu'i ngo bo'i sbyin pa dag sbyin par byed na phyug por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: If one gives gifts of such a nature, one will become wealthy.

original: mdza' bo dang grogs po dang snag gi gnyen mtshams mang po dang ldan par 'gyur zhing mdzes shing gzugs bzang ba dang / grags pa dang stobs che ba can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mdza' bo dang grogs po dang snag gi gnyen mtshams mang po dang ldan par 'gyur zhing mdzes shing gzugs bzang ba dang / grags pa dang stobs che ba can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: One will have many friends, companions, and relatives. One will be beautiful, have a good figure, be famous, and be powerful.

original: skye bo mang po dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bo mang po dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar mi 'gyur te /

original: dge slong dag 'di lta bu'i ngo bo sbyin pa sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa 'di lta bur re bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta bu'i ngo bo sbyin pa sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa 'di lta bur re bar bya'o //
translated: Monks, if one gives gifts of such a nature, one should expect such a maturation.

original: de la gal te 'di lta bu'i sbyin pa kha dog dang dri dang ro phun sum tshogs pa 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i sbyin pa dag sbyin par byed na phyug por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la gal te 'di lta bu'i sbyin pa kha dog dang dri dang ro phun sum tshogs pa 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i sbyin pa dag sbyin par byed na phyug por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: If one gives gifts of such a nature, of perfect color, smell, and taste, one will become wealthy.

original: grogs po dang mdza' bo dang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams mang po dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: grogs po dang mdza' bo dang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams mang po dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: He will have many friends, loved ones, relatives, and blood relations.

original: mdzes shing gzugs bzang ba dang / grags pa dang / stobs che ba dang / skye bo mang po dga' zhing yid du 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdzes shing gzugs bzang ba dang / grags pa dang / stobs che ba dang / skye bo mang po dga' zhing yid du 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: He will be beautiful, have a good physique, be famous, have great strength, and be loved and pleasing to many people.

original: dge slong dag 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i sbyin pa dag sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa 'di lta bur re bar bya'o //🔽rnam pa du ma phun tshogs shing //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i sbyin pa dag sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa 'di lta bur re bar bya'o // rnam pa du ma phun tshogs shing //
translated: Monks, if you give gifts with such a nature, you should hope for such a maturation.

original: ser sna med par sbyin byed na //
analyzed: ser sna med par sbyin byed na //
translated: When one gives without stinginess

original: rnam pa du ma phun tshogs pa pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa du ma phun tshogs pa pa'i //
translated: with abundant various things,

original: rnam par smin pa so sor bsten //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa so sor bsten //

original: mig gis yid 'ong gzugs mthong zhing //
analyzed: mig gis yid 'ong gzugs mthong zhing //
translated: One will see with the eye pleasant forms,

original: sgra dang dri dang de bzhin ro //
analyzed: sgra dang dri dang de bzhin ro //
translated: sounds, smells, and likewise tastes,

original: lus kyis yid 'ong reg bya dag //
analyzed: lus kyis yid 'ong reg bya dag //
translated: and with the body pleasant touchables

original: so sor kun du bsten par 'gyur //
analyzed: so sor kun du bsten par 'gyur //
translated: that are individually attended to.

original: las kyi rnam smin las skyes pa'i //
analyzed: las kyi rnam smin las skyes pa'i //

original: yid kyis chos rnams shes pa dang // yid du 'ong ba shes 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: yid kyis chos rnams shes pa dang // yid du 'ong ba shes 'gyur gyi //
translated: One knows phenomena with the mind, and knows what is pleasing.

original: nam yang yid du mi 'ong min //🔽rnam pa du ma phun sum tshogs shing //
analyzed: nam yang yid du mi 'ong min // rnam pa du ma phun sum tshogs shing //
translated: But never what is unpleasing.🔽When one gives with a mind of many forms,

original: ser sna med par sbyin byed na //
analyzed: ser sna med par sbyin byed na //
translated: and gives without stinginess,🔽one will experience the ripening

original: rnam pa du ma phun tshogs pa'i //🔽rnam par smin pa so sor bsten //
analyzed: rnam pa du ma phun tshogs pa'i // rnam par smin pa so sor bsten //
translated: of a mind of many forms.

original: lnga tshan lnga pa'i dmigs pa dang // mi dmigs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / mu bzhi pa'i mdo'i tshig las 'di dag nye bar bkod pa'o //
analyzed: lnga tshan lnga pa'i dmigs pa dang // mi dmigs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / mu bzhi pa'i mdo'i tshig las 'di dag nye bar bkod pa'o //
translated: These verses are presented in relation to the five sets of five, the verse on non-apprehension, and the four-cornered Sūtra.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji @254a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji @254a * //
translated: As the Blessed One said:

original: skad du dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa brgya la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skad du dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa brgya la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For example, one hundred beings born as animals...

original: bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gzhi n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gzhi n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in the Nyagrodha Park of Kapilavastu.

original: de na skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i gos sar pa gser gyi mdog lta bu zung gnyis khyer te /
analyzed: de na skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i gos sar pa gser gyi mdog lta bu zung gnyis khyer te /
translated: There, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī brought two pairs of new golden-colored robes,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba ba der nye bar song ste nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la spyi bos phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba ba der nye bar song ste nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la spyi bos phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: She approached the Blessed One, bowed her head at his feet, and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Seated to one side, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa gos sar pa gser gyi mdog lta bu zung 'di gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyis mnabs par 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir rang nyid kyis bgyis pa lags kyis /
analyzed: btsun pa gos sar pa gser gyi mdog lta bu zung 'di gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyis mnabs par 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir rang nyid kyis bgyis pa lags kyis /
translated: “Venerable, I have made these two sets of new golden-colored robes for the Blessed One.

original: 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs rtse ba'i slad du bzhes su gsol //
analyzed: 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs rtse ba'i slad du bzhes su gsol //
translated: Please accept them out of love for me.”🔽“Gautamī, offer them to the saṅgha.

original: goo ta ma'i 'di dag dge 'dun la phul cig / dge 'dun la phul na nga dang dge 'dun gyis longs spyad pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goo ta ma'i 'di dag dge 'dun la phul cig / dge 'dun la phul na nga dang dge 'dun gyis longs spyad pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you offer them to the saṅgha, I and the saṅgha will use them.”

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du bcom ldan 'das la skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du bcom ldan 'das la skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī made the same request a second and a third time, and the Blessed One replied a second and a third time,🔽“Gautamī, offer them to the saṅgha.

original: btsun pa gos sar pa gser gyi mdog lta bu zung gnyis po 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis mnabs par 'gyur ro zhas bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir rang nyid kyis bgyis pa lags kyis bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse ba'i slad du 'di dag bzhes su gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa gos sar pa gser gyi mdog lta bu zung gnyis po 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis mnabs par 'gyur ro zhas bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir rang nyid kyis bgyis pa lags kyis bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse ba'i slad du 'di dag bzhes su gsol /
translated: “Venerable One, these two new golden-colored robes were made by myself for the Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lan gnyis lan gsum du skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta mi la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lan gnyis lan gsum du skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta mi la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One spoke to Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī a second and a third time:

original: goo ta ma'i dge 'dun la phul cig / dge 'dun la phul na nga dang dge 'dun gyis longs spyod pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goo ta ma'i dge 'dun la phul cig / dge 'dun la phul na nga dang dge 'dun gyis longs spyod pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Gautamī, offer them to the saṅgha of monks. If you offer them to the saṅgha of monks, it will be as if I and the saṅgha of monks have used them.”

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyab logs na rlung yab thogs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyab logs na rlung yab thogs te /
translated: At that time, the venerable Ānanda was standing behind the Blessed One, fanning him.

original: bcom ldan 'das la rlung yab g-yob cing 'dug par 'gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rlung yab g-yob cing 'dug par 'gyur to //
translated: He was standing there fanning the Blessed One.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i ni bcom ldan 'das la phan pa mang po byed pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i ni bcom ldan 'das la phan pa mang po byed pa ste /
translated: The Venerable Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī has done much for the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das @254b btsas ma thag tu yum sgyu ma dus las 'das te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @254b btsas ma thag tu yum sgyu ma dus las 'das te /
translated: Soon after the Blessed One was born, his mother Māyā passed away.

original: rang gi nu ma bsnun cing gsos cher bskyed pa lags kyis /
analyzed: rang gi nu ma bsnun cing gsos cher bskyed pa lags kyis /
translated: She nursed him at her breast and raised him until he was a great child.

original: bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse bar dgongs te gos sar pa gser gyi mdog lta bu zung gnyis po 'di skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo las bzhes su gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse bar dgongs te gos sar pa gser gyi mdog lta bu zung gnyis po 'di skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo las bzhes su gsol /
translated: May the Blessed One, out of love, accept these two new sets of golden-colored robes from Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī.”

original: kun dga' bo de de bzhin te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de de bzhin te /
translated: “Ānanda, it is so.

original: skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i ni nga la phan pa mang po byed pa btsas pa ma thag tu yum sgyu ma dus las 'das te rang gi nu ma bsnun zhing gsos cher bskyed pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i ni nga la phan pa mang po byed pa btsas pa ma thag tu yum sgyu ma dus las 'das te rang gi nu ma bsnun zhing gsos cher bskyed pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī has done much for me. Soon after I was born, my mother Māyā passed away, and she nursed me at her breast and raised me until I was a great child.

original: 'on kyang nga yang skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo la phan pa mang po byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang nga yang skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo la phan pa mang po byed pa ste /
translated: But I have also done much for Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun dga' bo dge ba'i bshes gnyen nga dang phrad pas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo sangs rgyas la mngon par dad cing chos dang dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa dang / sangs rgyas la skyabs su song chos dang dge 'dun las skyabs su song /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge ba'i bshes gnyen nga dang phrad pas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo sangs rgyas la mngon par dad cing chos dang dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa dang / sangs rgyas la skyabs su song chos dang dge 'dun las skyabs su song /
translated: Ānanda, because she met me, her spiritual friend, Mahāprajāpatī has faith in the Buddha, faith in the Dharma and the Saṅgha, and has gone for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: sangs rgyas la mtha' gcig tu nges /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mtha' gcig tu nges /
translated: She is certain about the Buddha,

original: chos dang dge 'dun la mtha' gcig tu nges /
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun la mtha' gcig tu nges /
translated: certain about the Dharma and the Saṅgha,

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la the tshom dang yid gnyis dang bral /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la the tshom dang yid gnyis dang bral /

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang lam la the tshom dang yid gnyis dang bral /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang lam la the tshom dang yid gnyis dang bral /
translated: She is free of doubt and uncertainty about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

analyzed: bden pa mthong zhing phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu rtogs te /
translated: She has seen the truths and realized the fruit of a nonreturner.

analyzed: kun dga' bo gang zag gang zhig gang zag gang zhig dang phrad pas sangs rgyas la mngon par dang / chos dang dge 'dun la mngon par dang / sangs rgyas la skyabs su song /
translated: Ānanda, because of meeting me, her spiritual friend, Mahāprajāpatī has faith in the Buddha, faith in the Dharma and the Saṅgha, and has gone for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su song /
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su song /
translated: He has taken refuge in the Dharma and the Saṅgha.

original: sangs rgyas la mtha' gcig tu nges /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mtha' gcig tu nges /
translated: He is absolutely certain about the Buddha.

original: chos dang dge 'dun la mtha' gcig tu nges /
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun la mtha' gcig tu nges /
translated: He is absolutely certain about the Dharma and the Saṅgha.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la the tshom dang yid gnyis dang bral /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la the tshom dang yid gnyis dang bral /

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la the tshom dang yid gnyis dang bral /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la the tshom dang yid gnyis dang bral /
translated: He is free of doubt and uncertainty about suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

original: bden pa mthong zhing phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon par rtogs te /🔽gang zag de la gang zag 'dis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bden pa mthong zhing phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon par rtogs te / gang zag de la gang zag 'dis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du 'di lta ste /
translated: He has seen the truth and realized the fruit of a non-returner.

original: chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / nye bar byas pa thams cad kyis lan glan par sla ba ma yin no //🔽kun dga' bo dge 'dun du gyur pa'i @255a * //
analyzed: chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / nye bar byas pa thams cad kyis lan glan par sla ba ma yin no // kun dga' bo dge 'dun du gyur pa'i @255a * //
translated: It is not easy for this person to repay this person for the rest of his life with Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the ill, and all the services.

original: yon gnas bdun dang gang zag ni bcu bzhi yod de /
analyzed: yon gnas bdun dang gang zag ni bcu bzhi yod de /
translated: Ānanda, there are fourteen individuals who are worthy of offerings in the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun du gyur pa yon gnas bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun du gyur pa yon gnas bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven types of worthy recipients in the Saṅgha?

original: sangs rgyas la mngon du phyogs te dge slong gi dge 'dun la sbyin pa byin na dge 'dun yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mngon du phyogs te dge slong gi dge 'dun la sbyin pa byin na dge 'dun yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives to the community of monks who are in the presence of the Buddha, the community is the recipient.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun la sbyin pa byin na dge 'dun yon gnas yin no //🔽dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na yang dge 'dun yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun la sbyin pa byin na dge 'dun yon gnas yin no // dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na yang dge 'dun yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives to the community of monks, the community is the recipient.🔽If one gives to the community of nuns, the community is the recipient.

original: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na dge 'dun yon gnas yin no //🔽dge slong gi dge 'dun 'di tsam gshegs shig ces sbyin pa sbyin par byed na yang dge 'dun yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na dge 'dun yon gnas yin no // dge slong gi dge 'dun 'di tsam gshegs shig ces sbyin pa sbyin par byed na yang dge 'dun yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives to the community of both monks and nuns, the community is the recipient.🔽If one gives with the instruction, “Let this much of the community of monks come,” the community is the recipient.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun 'di tsam gshegs shig ces sbyin pa sbyin par byed na yang dge 'dun yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun 'di tsam gshegs shig ces sbyin pa sbyin par byed na yang dge 'dun yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives with the instruction, “Let this much of the community of nuns come,” the community is the recipient.

original: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun la 'di tsam gshegs shig / ces sbyin pa sbyin par byed na dge 'dun yon gnas yin no zhes bya ba dang / kun dga' bo ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sa'i rigs zhes bya ba la mgul pa chos gos tshal bu thogs pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun la 'di tsam gshegs shig / ces sbyin pa sbyin par byed na dge 'dun yon gnas yin no zhes bya ba dang / kun dga' bo ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sa'i rigs zhes bya ba la mgul pa chos gos tshal bu thogs pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Ānanda, in the future there will be those in the class called the earth-born, who will wear their Dharma robes in a way that exposes the neck.

original: de la yang bram ze dang khyim bdag gang zhig gis dge 'dun mngon par byas nas bsams shing dge 'dun du dmigs nas sbyin pa dag gtong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la yang bram ze dang khyim bdag gang zhig gis dge 'dun mngon par byas nas bsams shing dge 'dun du dmigs nas sbyin pa dag gtong bar 'gyur /
translated: If a brahmin or a householder, having invited the Saṅgha, thinks, “I will give gifts to the Saṅgha,”

original: bsod nams dag byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsod nams dag byed par 'gyur te /
translated: and if he makes merit,

original: de yang bsod nams kyi sgor 'gyur ro zhes nga smra'o //
analyzed: de yang bsod nams kyi sgor 'gyur ro zhes nga smra'o //
translated: I say that this will be a gateway to merit.

original: da ltar gyi dge 'dun la bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dge 'dun la bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: The present Saṅgha is perfect in patience,

original: mdzes pa phun sum tshogs pa /🔽zhi ba phun sum pa ;
analyzed: mdzes pa phun sum tshogs pa / zhi ba phun sum pa ;
translated: perfect in beauty,🔽perfect in peace,

original: dul ba phun sum tshogs pa /🔽spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: dul ba phun sum tshogs pa / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: perfect in self-control,🔽perfect in conduct,

original: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: perfect in deportment,

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa /

original: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa /

analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba phun sum tshogs pa sbyin pa'i 'os su gyur pa /

original: rab tu sbyin pa'i 'os su gyur pa /
analyzed: rab tu sbyin pa'i 'os su gyur pa /

analyzed: thal mo sbyar bar bya ba phyag gi 'os su gyur pa /
translated: He is worthy of being bowed to with joined palms.🔽He is worthy of being worshipped. What need is there to mention the unsurpassed qualities of the world?

original: 'jig rten gyi bla na med pa'i yon tan la lta smos kyang ci zhig dgos @255b kun dga' bo phyi rol pa la sbyin pa dang / legs par sbyin pa dang / mchod sbyin dang / sbyin pa'i zhing du gyur pa ji ltar dge slong gi dge 'dun yang dag par rjes su ngas ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bla na med pa'i yon tan la lta smos kyang ci zhig dgos @255b kun dga' bo phyi rol pa la sbyin pa dang / legs par sbyin pa dang / mchod sbyin dang / sbyin pa'i zhing du gyur pa ji ltar dge slong gi dge 'dun yang dag par rjes su ngas ma mthong ngo //
translated: Ānanda, I have not seen a field of merit that is as good as the Saṅgha of monks for giving, good giving, sacrifice, and giving to a recipient of giving.

analyzed: kun dga' bo 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la byang chub yas kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'bras bu chen po dang rjes su bsngags pa che zhing rgya che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Ananda, even if one gives to the noble Sangha, in the future one will have great fruit and great praise.

original: gang zag rnam pa bcu bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa bcu bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the fourteen kinds of individuals?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives to the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, one is giving to an individual who is a separate recipient of offerings.

original: rang sangs rgyas la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives to a Pratyekabuddha, one is giving to an individual who is a separate recipient of offerings.

original: dgra bcom pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives to an Arhat, one is giving to an individual who is a separate recipient of offerings.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives to one who has entered the path for the realization of the fruit of Arhatship, one is giving to an individual who is a separate recipient of offerings.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives to a Non-returner, one is giving to an individual who is a separate recipient of offerings.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives a gift to one who has entered the path to manifest the fruit of non-returner, one is a donor to an individual who is a worthy recipient.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no /
translated: If one gives a gift to a once-returner, one is a donor to an individual who is a worthy recipient.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives a gift to one who has entered the path to manifest the fruit of once-returner, one is a donor to an individual who is a worthy recipient.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives a gift to a stream-enterer, one is a donor to an individual who is a worthy recipient.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so sor yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so sor yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives a gift to one who has entered the path to manifest the fruit of stream-enterer, one is a donor to an individual who is a worthy recipient.

original: phyi'i drang srong 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i drang srong 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives a gift to an external sage who is free from attachment to the desire realm, one is a donor to an individual who is a worthy recipient.

original: skyes bu gang zag tshul khrims dang ldan pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //🔽tshul khrims 'tshal pa'i skyes bu gang zag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag tshul khrims dang ldan pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no // tshul khrims 'tshal pa'i skyes bu gang zag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //
translated: If one gives a gift to a person who is morally disciplined, one is a donor to an individual who is a holy person.🔽If one gives a gift to a person who is morally disciplined, one is a donor to an individual who is a holy person.

original: dud 'gror song ba'i srog chags la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no //🔽kun dga' bo de la dud 'gror song ba'i srog chags dag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed @256a * //
analyzed: dud 'gror song ba'i srog chags la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na gang zag so so yon gnas yin no // kun dga' bo de la dud 'gror song ba'i srog chags dag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed @256a * //
translated: If one gives a gift to an animal, one is a donor to an individual who is a holy person.

original: na rnam par smin pa brgya 'gyur du re bar bya'o //🔽tshul khrims 'chal pa'i skyes bu gang zag la sbyin pa sbyin na rnam par smin pa stong 'gyur du re bar bya'o //
analyzed: na rnam par smin pa brgya 'gyur du re bar bya'o // tshul khrims 'chal pa'i skyes bu gang zag la sbyin pa sbyin na rnam par smin pa stong 'gyur du re bar bya'o //
translated: Ānanda, if one gives a gift to an animal, one should expect a hundredfold result.🔽If one gives a gift to a person who is morally undisciplined, one should expect a thousandfold result.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i skyes bu gang zag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa 'bum 'gyur du re bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i skyes bu gang zag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa 'bum 'gyur du re bar bya'o //
translated: If one gives a gift to a person who is morally disciplined, one should expect a hundred thousandfold result.

original: phyi'i drang srong 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa bye ba 'bum 'gyur du re bar bya'o //🔽rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa tshad med do //
analyzed: phyi'i drang srong 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa bye ba 'bum 'gyur du re bar bya'o // rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na rnam par smin pa tshad med do //
translated: If one gives to external sages who are free from attachment to sense objects, one should expect a hundred thousand times the maturation.🔽If one gives to one who has entered the path for the sake of manifesting the fruit of stream-enterer, the maturation is immeasurable.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa la byin na ches tshad med do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa la byin na ches tshad med do //
translated: If one gives to one who has attained the fruit of stream-enterer, it is even more immeasurable.

original: de bas kyang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la byin na ches tshad med do //
analyzed: de bas kyang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la byin na ches tshad med do //
translated: Even more immeasurable than that is giving to one who has entered the path for the sake of manifesting the fruit of once-returner.

original: de bas kyang lan cig phyir 'ong ba la byin na ches tshad med do //🔽de bas kyang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la byin na ches tshad med do //
analyzed: de bas kyang lan cig phyir 'ong ba la byin na ches tshad med do // de bas kyang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la byin na ches tshad med do //
translated: Even more immeasurable than that is giving to one who has attained the fruit of once-returner.🔽Even more immeasurable than that is giving to one who has entered the path for the sake of manifesting the fruit of non-returner.

original: de bas kyang phyir mi 'ong ba la byin na ches tshad med do //
analyzed: de bas kyang phyir mi 'ong ba la byin na ches tshad med do //
translated: Even more immeasurable than that is giving to one who has attained the fruit of non-returner.

original: de bas kyang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la byin na ches tshad med do //
analyzed: de bas kyang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la byin na ches tshad med do //
translated: It is even more immeasurable if given to those who have entered the path for the sake of actualizing the fruit of an arhat.

original: de bas kyang dgra bcom pa la byin na ches tshad med do //
analyzed: de bas kyang dgra bcom pa la byin na ches tshad med do //
translated: It is even more immeasurable if given to an arhat.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la 'bul bar byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la 'bul bar byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention giving to a pratyekabuddha or to a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha?

original: kun dga' bo sbyin pa bzhi po 'di dag ni sbyin pa dag par byed pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo sbyin pa bzhi po 'di dag ni sbyin pa dag par byed pa bzhi ste /
translated: Ānanda, these four gifts are the four that purify giving.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /🔽sbyin pa po yongs su dag la len pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa yang yod /🔽len pa yongs su dag la sbyin pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa yang yod /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / sbyin pa po yongs su dag la len pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa yang yod / len pa yongs su dag la sbyin pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa yang yod /
translated: What are the four?🔽There is giving where the giver is pure but the recipient is not pure.🔽There is giving where the recipient is pure but the giver is not pure.

original: sbyin pa po yang yongs su ma dag cing len pa po yang yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa yang yod /
analyzed: sbyin pa po yang yongs su ma dag cing len pa po yang yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa yang yod /
translated: There is giving where neither the giver nor the recipient is pure.

original: sbyin pa po yongs su dag pa la len pa po yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa po yongs su dag pa la len pa po yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is generosity where the giver is pure and the receiver is impure.

original: sbyin pa po yongs su ma dag pa la len pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa po yongs su ma dag pa la len pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is generosity where the giver is impure and the receiver is impure?

original: kun dga' bo 'di ni sbyin pa'i bdag po tshul khrims dang ldan pa bsdom pas bsdams shing /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ni sbyin pa'i bdag po tshul khrims dang ldan pa bsdom pas bsdams shing /
translated: Ānanda, here the donor is endowed with morality, restrained by the restraint of vows,

original: lung mthong la 'bras bu mthong nas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste sbyin @256b pa yang yod do //
analyzed: lung mthong la 'bras bu mthong nas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste sbyin @256b pa yang yod do //
translated: has seen the scriptures, and has seen the fruits. He thinks like this and speaks like this: “There is generosity.

original: sbyin pa sbyin na 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod do zhes smra la /
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin na 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod do zhes smra la /
translated: When generosity is given, there is a result that ripens.”

original: len pa po tshul khrims 'chal cing sdom pas ma bsdams la lung ma mthong la 'bras bu ma mthong nas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: len pa po tshul khrims 'chal cing sdom pas ma bsdams la lung ma mthong la 'bras bu ma mthong nas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: The receiver is immoral, unrestrained by the restraint of vows, has not seen the scriptures, and has not seen the fruits. He thinks like this and speaks like this:

original: sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa med do //
translated: “There is no generosity.

original: sbyin pa sbyin na 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes smra ba ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin na 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes smra ba ste /
translated: When generosity is given, there is no result that ripens.”

original: 'di ni sbyin pa po yongs su dag la len pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa po yongs su dag la len pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the generosity of a completely pure giver to an impure recipient.

original: len pa po yongs su dag la sbyin pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: len pa po yongs su dag la sbyin pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the generosity of an impure giver to a completely pure recipient?

original: kun dga' bo 'di ni sbyin pa'i bdag po tshul khrims 'chal cing sdom pas ma bsdoms shing lung ma mthong la 'bras bu ma mthong nas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ni sbyin pa'i bdag po tshul khrims 'chal cing sdom pas ma bsdoms shing lung ma mthong la 'bras bu ma mthong nas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: Ānanda, this is the generosity of a master of giving who has broken the precepts, is not restrained, has not seen the scriptures, and has not seen the fruits. He has such views and speaks in this way:

original: sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa med do //
translated: ‘There is no generosity.

original: sbyin pa sbyin pa la 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med pa'o zhes smra la /
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin pa la 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med pa'o zhes smra la /
translated: There is no result of giving or receiving generosity.’

original: len pa po tshul khrims dang ldan pa sdom pas bsdams shing lung mthong la 'bras bu mthong nas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: len pa po tshul khrims dang ldan pa sdom pas bsdams shing lung mthong la 'bras bu mthong nas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: But the recipient is endowed with the precepts, is restrained, has seen the scriptures, and has seen the fruits. He has such views and speaks in this way:

original: sbyin pa yod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa yod do //
translated: ‘There is generosity.

original: sbyin pa byin pa las 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod do zhes smra ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa las 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod do zhes smra ste /
translated: There is a result of giving and receiving generosity.’

analyzed: 'di ni len pa po yongs su dag la sbyin pa po yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called generosity where the recipient is pure but the giver is impure.

original: sbyin pa po yang yongs su ma dag la len pa po yang yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa po yang yongs su ma dag la len pa po yang yongs su ma dag pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is generosity where neither the giver nor the recipient is pure?

analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ni sbyin pa po tshul khrims 'chal cing sdom pas ma bsdams la lung ma mthong zhing 'bras bu ma mthong nas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: Ānanda, this is when the giver has faulty morality, is unrestrained, and has not seen the truths. They think and say:

original: sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa med do //
translated: ‘There is no generosity.
